SUMMARY: "Crews have been able to recover significant debris from the site, including all of the priority sensor and electronics pieces identified," U.S. Northern Command said.

TITLE: High-paying jobs that don't need a college degree? Thousands of them sit empty
SUMMARY: Trade jobs that require less education, at much lower cost, sit empty. But many parents remain wary of programs that don't lead to a four-year degree.

TITLE: Russia deports thousands of Ukrainian children. Investigators say that's a war crime
SUMMARY: A team at Yale University is using open-source materials to document the forced removal of Ukrainian children to Russia. Russia says it's a vast humanitarian program.

TITLE: A United Airlines flight took a steep dive to just 800 feet above the Pacific Ocean
SUMMARY: The airline says the two pilots of the December flight from Maui made a safety report after landing in San Francisco and are currently receiving additional training.

TITLE: European allies condemn Israel's plan to build more housing units in the West Bank
SUMMARY: France, Germany, Italy and the United Kingdom joined the U.S. in condemning Israel's plans to build 10,000 more housing units in existing settlements in the occupied West Bank.

TITLE: Timeline: How a Chinese 'spy balloon' prompted the U.S. to scour the skies
SUMMARY: The U.S. and China have traded fiery allegations of extensive aerial surveillance programs since the U.S. shot down a Chinese balloon on Feb. 4. Here's a look at what's happened so far.

TITLE: Senators downplay threats from unidentified objects, but call for more information
SUMMARY: Many Democrats defended the Biden administration's cautious approach. But lawmakers of both parties urged the president to address the nation.

TITLE: A Valentine's Day message from Banksy comments on violence against women
SUMMARY: The work depicts a woman who appears to be missing a tooth and whose eye is swollen shut. Shortly after it appeared in England, parts of the graffiti installation were dismantled by local officials.

TITLE: How a Chinese 'spy balloon' prompted the U.S. to scour the skies
SUMMARY: The U.S. and China have traded fiery allegations of extensive aerial surveillance programs since the U.S. shot down a Chinese balloon on Feb. 4. Here's a look at what's happened so far.

TITLE: Apparently, love does have a price. It's $25.9 billion
SUMMARY: Americans celebrating Valentine's Day are expected to spend an average of $192.80 each this year. That's, like, 11 boxes of fun dip packages.

TITLE: Senators talk about upping online safety for kids. This year they could do something
SUMMARY: During a Senate Judiciary Committee hearing, lawmakers blasted tech companies that they said do little to keep kids safe from bullying, addiction and "rabbit holes of dangerous material."

TITLE: Barney the purple dinosaur is coming back with a new show â and a new look
SUMMARY: Barney, the big purple dinosaur with a preschool following, will be returning to TV in 2024 with a new animated series, according to Mattel. A new film, toys and adult apparel are also in the works.

TITLE: Sen. Dianne Feinstein says she won't run for reelection in 2024
SUMMARY: Sen. Dianne Feinstein, D-Calif., the oldest sitting member of Congress, said she will accomplish as much as possible before she steps down.

TITLE: After a big recovery, the wood stork may soon fly off the endangered species list
SUMMARY: The ungainly yet graceful wood stork, which was on the brink of extinction in 1984, has rebounded dramatically in Florida and other Southern states, officials say.

TITLE: One of the deadliest federal prisons is closing
SUMMARY: The Bureau of Prisons is shutting down its newest federal penitentiary in Thomson, Ill., following a Marshall Project and NPR investigation that exposed it was rife with violence and abuse.

TITLE: New Zealand plans final rescues soon after a cyclone kills 2
SUMMARY: Cyclone Gabrielle struck the country's north on Monday and has brought more destruction to the country than any weather event in years.

TITLE: One of the deadliest federal prison units is closing
SUMMARY: The Bureau of Prisons is shutting down a unit at its newest penitentiary in Illinois, following an investigation by NPR and The Marshall Project that exposed it was rife with violence and abuse.

TITLE: U.S. arrests 4 in Florida over the assassination of Haitian president
SUMMARY: U.S. authorities have arrested four more people in the slaying of Haitian President Jovenel MoÃ¯se, including the owner of a Miami-area security company, prosecutors announced.

TITLE: New Zealand plans final rescues soon after a cyclone kills at least 4
SUMMARY: Cyclone Gabrielle struck the country's north on Monday and has brought more destruction to the country than any weather event in years.

TITLE: U.N. agencies seek $5.6 billion to help Ukraine, its refugees abroad
SUMMARY: The U.N.'s humanitarian aid and refugee agencies are seeking $5.6 billion to help millions of people in Ukraine and countries that have taken in fleeing Ukrainians in the wake of Russia's invasion.

TITLE: Turkey buries its earthquake dead in small cemeteries and mass graves
SUMMARY: With so many killed suddenly in the quake, Turkey faces the challenge of burying tens of thousands of people. Multiple funerals are happening at once and the process of burying the dead is constant.

TITLE: Shopify deleted 322,000 hours of meetings. Should the rest of us be jealous?
SUMMARY: The pandemic had an unexpected side effect: peak meeting misery. With Shopify's radical announcement last month, the working world wants to know if a future without meetings is even possible.

TITLE: 'Imagining Freedom' will give $125 million to art projects focused on incarceration
SUMMARY: Since 2020, the Mellon Foundation has given over $40 million to arts and humanities projects addressing mass incarceration. In all, it says, it will donate $125 million to such efforts.

TITLE: When politicians have no shame, the old rules don't apply
SUMMARY: Rep. George Santos, a Republican freshman who fabricated much of his life story but has defiantly resisted public pressure to leave, has shown just how much things have changed.

TITLE: Meet the judge deciding the $1.6 billion defamation case against Fox News
SUMMARY: Delaware Judge Eric M. Davis, known for his poker face, is overseeing both Dominion Voting Systems' lawsuit against Fox News and a similar case against the conservative TV network Newsmax.

TITLE: New childhood obesity guidance raises worries over the risk of eating disorders
SUMMARY: Many eating disorder specialists oppose the new guidance's focus on weight loss and BMI, and say it minimizes the risk of disordered eating and will perpetuate deep-rooted, damaging stigmas.

TITLE: How do pandemics begin? There's a new theory â and a new strategy to thwart them
SUMMARY: Animals carry millions of pathogens. So it's a daunting task to find the one with the greatest potential to spark a pandemic. Now scientists are rethinking the way they hunt for that next new virus.

TITLE: Scotland's Nicola Sturgeon will resign, complicating the independence movement
SUMMARY: After more than eight years as the head of her country's government, Nicola Sturgeon will resign from her First Minister post, she announced Wednesday.

TITLE: Pharrell Williams succeeds Virgil Abloh as the head of men's designs at Louis Vuitton
SUMMARY: The singer, producer and designer has a long history of working with fashion brands â as well as big shoes to fill. Williams' first Louis Vuitton collection will debut at Men's Fashion Week in June.

TITLE: How the politics of race will play a key role in Nikki Haley's 2024 campaign
SUMMARY: Haley is a woman of color who led South Carolina in taking down the Confederate flag from its state capitol. That makes campaigning complex in the party of Trump.

TITLE: Airborne 'low speed clutter' not National Weather Service's fault
SUMMARY: The U.S. military started tracking more airborne objects it calls "low speed clutter" after shooting down a Chinese balloon. Weather forecasters know how to stay out of the way.

TITLE: A hazardous spill in Arizona closes down an interstate and forces an evacuation
SUMMARY: Interstate 10 remained closed outside Tucson on Wednesday, the day after a truck crash caused a hazardous material leak and forced evacuations nearby. The driver of the truck was killed in the crash.

TITLE: The Buffalo Tops shooter has been sentenced to life in prison without parole
SUMMARY: The 19-year-old also faces 27 charges at the federal level, one of which carries a possible death sentence. He will make an appearance in federal court this week.

TITLE: One of 12 boys rescued from the Thai cave dies at a British school
SUMMARY: The captian of the boys soccer team rescued from a flooded cave in Thailand in 2018 was found unconscious in his room at the sports academy he was attending in England.

TITLE: The U.S. could run out of cash to pay its bills between July and September
SUMMARY: If Congress fails to raise the nation's $31.4 trillion debt ceiling, the U.S. government could run out of cash between July and September, or even sooner, the Congressional Budget Office said.

TITLE: A new study offers hints that healthier school lunches may help reduce obesity
SUMMARY: The national study found a small but significant decline in the average BMI of more than 14,000 schoolkids after implementation of a 2010 federal law that boosted nutrition standards for school meals.

TITLE: How financial counseling at the pediatrician's office can help families thrive
SUMMARY: Researchers paired new parents with financial coaches in a pediatric clinic. They found the families were more likely to come for well-child visits and vaccinations â and they got ahead financially.

TITLE: Scotland's Nicola Sturgeon, supporter of independence and trans rights, will resign
SUMMARY: Nicola Sturgeon will resign from her first minister post, she announced Wednesday. The move is prompting a new conversations about trans rights, independence and Jacinda Ardern.

TITLE: NORAD is back in the news. So what does it do, exactly?
SUMMARY: The air defense center was created in the 1950s, as a counter to a rival superpower. Now NORAD is front and center again, prompting questions about what it does â and how it copes with modern threats.

TITLE: Dozens of inmates have died in a Houston jail since 2021. Now the FBI is investigating
SUMMARY: Dozens of inmates have died while in custody at the Harris County Jail, according to attorneys representing victims' families. The FBI has opened civil rights investigations into two of the deaths.

TITLE: Biden set his 'moonshot' on cancer. Meet the doctor trying to get us there
SUMMARY: When it comes to curing cancer, President Joe Biden is shifting that sentiment into full throttle. And one person is leading the charge.

TITLE: Famous poet Pablo Neruda was poisoned after a coup, according to a new report
SUMMARY: His nephew says scientists found high levels of the bacterium that can cause botulism poisoning. He says it proves that his uncle was injected with the poison at a hospital immediately after the coup.

TITLE: Balloon shoot-down has U.S. on alert. Weather forecasters know how to steer clear
SUMMARY: The U.S. military started tracking more airborne objects it calls "low speed clutter" after shooting down the Chinese balloon. The National Weather Service says it launches about 184 balloons a day.

TITLE: Istanbul's mayor warns 90,000 buildings are at risk if a major earthquake strikes
SUMMARY: The warning for Turkey's largest city comes as the death toll from last week's quake in Turkey and northern Syria now exceeds 40,000.

TITLE: David Malpass is stepping down as president of the World Bank
SUMMARY: Appointed by then-President Trump in 2019, he is leaving before his five-year term expires. Malpass faced backlash over his comments at Climate Week NYC in 2022.

TITLE: From tracking Santa to Chinese spy balloons, here's what we know about NORAD
SUMMARY: The air defense center was created in the 1950s, as a counter to a rival superpower. Now NORAD is front and center again, prompting questions about what it does â and how it copes with modern threats.

TITLE: A Black Hawk helicopter from the Tennessee National Guard has crashed
SUMMARY: U.S. military officials said both of the people on board were killed when the helicopter crashed in Alabama during a training mission.

TITLE: 1 person was killed and 3 others injured in a shooting at an El Paso mall
SUMMARY: The shooting happened in a busy shopping area and across a large parking lot from a Walmart where 23 people were killed in a racist attack in 2019.

TITLE: Upset Ohio town residents seek answers over train derailment
SUMMARY: Hundreds of worried people gathered to hear state officials tell them that testing so far has shown local air is safe to breathe and to promise that safety testing of the air and water would continue.

TITLE: A skinny robot documents the forces eroding a massive Antarctic glacier
SUMMARY: Scientists got their first up-close look at what's eating away part of Antarctica's Thwaites ice shelf, nicknamed the Doomsday Glacier because of its massive melt and sea rise potential.

TITLE: Raquel Welch, actress and Hollywood sex symbol, dead at 82
SUMMARY: Welch is best known for her roles in Fantastic Voyage and One Million Years B.C.

TITLE: English police say they foiled an 'eggs-travagent' plot to steal Cadbury chocolates
SUMMARY: A 32-year-old man reportedly entered guilty pleas to an attempt to seize about 200,00 Cadbury Creme Eggs in a semi truck in central England.

TITLE: Lowriding was born in California but it's restricted. Lawmakers want to change that
SUMMARY: State law bars some modified vehicles and lets cities enact cruising bans. Lowrider advocates and Californian legislators say it criminalizes cultural traditions.

TITLE: An owl that escaped from the Central Park Zoo is still loose â and hunting on his own
SUMMARY: The owl escaped after its enclosure was vandalized nearly two weeks ago. Zoo officials were worried he wouldn't be able to hunt and eat because he's used to captivity, but that's no longer a concern.

TITLE: The earthquake in Turkey and Syria offers lessons and reminders for disaster response
SUMMARY: Even as rescuers rush to arrive, it's often locals who can best offer immediate help, experts say. And they say governments in devastated areas often fail to realize the scope and respond immediately.

TITLE: How seniors could lose in the Medicare political wars
SUMMARY: Politicians are again pointing fingers over cutting Medicare. Any party accused of threatening the program tends to lose elections, but without a bipartisan agreement, seniors stand to lose the most.

TITLE: Nearly 30 women are suing Olaplex, alleging products caused hair loss
SUMMARY: Women claim in a lawsuit Olaplex's range of products, numbered 0 through 9, contain allergens and irritants that caused hair loss and other problems, including contact dermatitis and brittleness.

TITLE: Democrats control Michigan for the first time in 40 years. They want gun control
SUMMARY: Having been blocked by Republican legislatures on regulation in the past, Michigan Democrats are forging ahead on tighter gun restrictions after the shooting at Michigan State.

TITLE: Kid YouTube stars make sugary junk food look good â to millions of young viewers
SUMMARY: The platform banned food advertising, yet many videos viewed by millions of kids continue to showcase candy, soda and packaged snacks, likely affecting kids' food preferences, researchers say.

TITLE: What to know about the train derailment in East Palestine, Ohio
SUMMARY: A train carrying hazardous materials derailed earlier this month in eastern Ohio, prompting officials to evacuate the area to conduct a controlled burn. Officials say air quality is now safe.

TITLE: Indian tax inspectors are still searching BBC offices, with some staying overnight
SUMMARY: Around 10 BBC employees have been sleeping in their office since Tuesday. Some of the tax agents stayed overnight too. They searched laptops and phones of some journalists and administrative staff.

TITLE: 10 things to know about how social media affects teens' brains
SUMMARY: Eye-opening testimony from a top scientist offers a useful primer on the role social media may play in the teen mental health crisis.

TITLE: Retirees in China hold rare protests against health insurance reforms
SUMMARY: Retirees have protested in two Chinese cities over fears that the authorities will dip into their personal health savings accounts to cover public budget shortfalls.

TITLE: Newly released footage of a 1986 Titanic dive reveals the ship's haunting interior
SUMMARY: The Titanic's rust-caked bow, an officer's cabin and a promenade window are part of the never-before-seen footage of the shipwreck site, which continues to slowly vanish 12,500 feet below the waves.

TITLE: Michael Jordan sets another record â a $10 million donation to Make-A-Wish
SUMMARY: Make-A-Wish said the NBA legend's donation is the largest individual contribution it has ever received. It said Jordan's gift will create an endowment to fulfill future wishes.

TITLE: Kentucky high court upholds state abortion bans while case continues
SUMMARY: The state Supreme Court kept two state bans in place after Kentucky voters signaled support for abortion rights at the ballot box last November.

TITLE: 2 deputies who were suspended in the Tyre Nichols case didn't keep their bodycams on
SUMMARY: Two sheriff's deputies who have been suspended for five days failed to keep their body cameras activated after they went to the location where Nichols had been beaten by Memphis police, officials say.

TITLE: Nicaragua strips 94 political opponents of citizenship
SUMMARY: President Daniel Ortega intensifies his political crackdown, stripping 94 of the most prominent Nicaraguan writers, journalists and human rights activists of citizenship. They lose all their rights.

TITLE: Spain approves menstrual leave, teen abortion and trans laws
SUMMARY: Among the enacted changes, 16- and 17-year-olds will be allowed to undergo an abortion without parental consent. And workers suffering debilitating period pain can take paid time off.

TITLE: Ukraine says it shot down 6 Russian balloons that appeared over Kyiv
SUMMARY: A spokesman for Ukraine's air force said the balloons had plain metal triangles suspended with string below them, saying that was enough to appear like an incoming missile or drone on radars.

TITLE: Biden says 3 aerial objects were 'most likely' tied to private companies or research
SUMMARY: In remarks Friday, President Biden said the three aerial objects shot down by U.S. military were most likely tied to private companies, recreation or research institutions.

TITLE: Mikaela Shiffrin wins gold in giant slalom at the world championships
SUMMARY: The victory makes Shiffrin only the fourth female skier to win world titles in four different disciplines. Last month, she broke Lindsey Vonn's women's record of 82 World Cup wins.

TITLE: Tesla recalls nearly 363,000 cars with 'Full Self-Driving' to fix flaws in behavior
SUMMARY: Tesla is recalling the vehicles to fix problems with the way the "Full Self-Driving" system behaves around intersections and following posted speed limits. The fix will come in a software update.

TITLE: Indian tax inspectors leave BBC offices after nearly 60 hours of questioning

TITLE: Arby's+? More restaurants try subscription programs to keep eaters coming back
SUMMARY: Large chains like Panera and P.F. Chang's as well as neighborhood hangouts are increasingly experimenting with the subscription model as a way to ensure steady revenue and customer visits.

TITLE: An ER doc reflects on life, death and uncertainty in the early days of COVID-19
SUMMARY: Dr. Farzon Nahvi spent the first few months of the pandemic as an emergency room physician in Manhattan. He talks about trying to improvise treatments during that time. His new book is <em>Code Gray.

TITLE: She left her 2007 iPhone in its box for over a decade. It just sold for $63K
SUMMARY: The iPhone was auctioned off for over 100 times more than its original cost â the latest record-breaking sum for such a sale.  An expert explains how old gadgets became "similar to precious metals."

TITLE: The EPA steps in to take over the East Palestine train derailment cleanup
SUMMARY: Under the legal order, Norfolk Southern is responsible for the costs and cleanup of soil and water contaminated by the release of hazardous chemicals from its derailed train earlier this month.

TITLE: Lentil soup comes to the rescue in quake-ravaged Turkey
SUMMARY: It's a supersoup during this humanitarian crisis. Easy to make, it warms the displaced, fuels rescue crews and comforts residents traumatized by the disaster.

TITLE: Mexico's former public security head is convicted in the U.S. of taking cartel bribes
SUMMARY: GarcÃ­a Luna headed Mexico's federal police and became the country's top public safety official between 2006 and 2012. He was convicted of taking large bribes from drug cartels.

TITLE: An explosion at an Ohio metal plant left 1 dead and 13 injured
SUMMARY: The cause of the fatal explosion is still unclear. It scattered debris for hundreds of yards, damaged vehicles and caused a plume of smoke visible for miles.

TITLE: No ideological splits, only worried justices as High Court hears Google case
SUMMARY: At issue in the case is a 1996 law that shields internet platforms from being sued for material that appears on their sites.

TITLE: After Russia finds "no fault" in doping scandal of figure skater, WADA appeals case
SUMMARY: Kamila Valieva helped Russia win gold in team figure skating at the 2022 Beijing Olympics. It wasn't until after the competition that it was learned she'd previously tested positive for doping.

TITLE: We're talking about the 4-day workweek â again. It is a mirage or reality?
SUMMARY: The concept of a perma-long weekend is so attractive. But it's starting to feel like that mirage of an oasis in the desert. We're desperate for some relief but it always seems <em>just

TITLE: A huge winter storm is expected to affect millions across 22 states
SUMMARY: The winter storm will bring "a large swath of heavy snow from the West Coast to the Northeast" this week, the National Weather Service says.

TITLE: A discarded cigarette butt and DNA tests solve a 52-year-old murder of Vermont woman
SUMMARY: A discarded cigarette found near the body of a Vermont school teacher in her apartment nearly 52 years ago helped lead investigators to a neighbor who they say strangled her, Vermont police said.

TITLE: The Home Depot says it is spending $1 billion to raise its starting wage to $15
SUMMARY: The starting wage for associates at The Home Depot is now $15, the company announced Tuesday.

TITLE: Poll: Biden's standing improves, while Trump slumps with Republican voters
SUMMARY: President Biden's approval rating has ticked up, and Democrats are growing more confident in him. Trump, meanwhile, is seeing his lowest scores with Republicans in seven years.

TITLE: The vast majority of criminal cases end in plea bargains, a new report finds
SUMMARY: The practice prioritizes efficiency over fairness and innocence, the American Bar Association says, and leads innocent people to be coerced into guilty pleas.

TITLE: Fixing the health care worker shortage may be something Congress can agree on
SUMMARY: The U.S. faces a shortfall of about 450,000 nurses and 120,000 doctors in the coming years. The Senate's top health committee, led by Sen. Bernie Sanders, is considering bipartisan solutions.

TITLE: The ripple effects of Russia's war in Ukraine continue to change the world
SUMMARY: A year after Russia's invasion of Ukraine sparked the largest conflict in Europe since World War II, the repercussions continue to reverberate.

TITLE: Ukraine's birth rate was already unsustainably low. Then war broke out
SUMMARY: The Russian invasion has cemented the decision for many couples to opt out of having babies, in a country that struggled with incredibly low fertility rates long before the war.

TITLE: Seattle becomes the first U.S. city to ban caste discrimination
SUMMARY: Calls to outlaw discrimination based on caste, a division of people based on birth or descent, have grown louder among South Asian diaspora communities in the United States.

TITLE: After Russia finds 'no fault' in doping scandal of figure skater, WADA appeals case
SUMMARY: Kamila Valieva helped Russia win gold in team figure skating at the 2022 Beijing Olympics. It wasn't until after the competition that it was learned she'd previously tested positive for doping.

SUMMARY: Just before he invaded Ukraine, Russian President Vladimir Putin agreed with other leaders that "a nuclear war cannot be won and must never be fought." So why is he eroding a key treaty?

TITLE: Northern states are shutting down ahead of coast-to-coast winter storm
SUMMARY: Heavy snow and high winds could lead to blizzard conditions in the Upper Midwest on Wednesday, the National Weather Service says. Nearly half the country could experience some notable weather impact.

SUMMARY: The Israeli military says it was targeting a militant group in the West Bank called the Lion's Den. So far this year, at least 55 Palestinians â including civilians â have been killed.

SUMMARY: U.S. Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin says the U.S. wants to put Ukraine in the best position to end the war, but he declined to say if battlefield victories or diplomacy were the shared end goal.

SUMMARY: From relentless campaigning to snubs and speeches, the Academy Awards have often reflected a cultural conflict zone. Michael Schulman sifts through the controversies in a new book.

TITLE: NPR says it's cutting jobs by 10% as ad revenue drops
SUMMARY: NPR must lay off 10% of its workforce to address an advertising shortfall of about $30 million, CEO John Lansing says. Lansing says marketers are nervous about the economy.

TITLE: Clues to Bronze Age cranial surgery revealed in ancient bones
SUMMARY: Archaeologists have discovered evidence of a rare type of skull surgery dating back to the Bronze Age that's similar to a procedure still being used today.

TITLE: The Webb telescope finds surprisingly massive galaxies from the universe's youth
SUMMARY: At about 600 million years after the Big Bang, they're not the oldest galaxies the telescope has spotted. But they appear as developed as our Milky Way â far further along than researchers expected.

TITLE: Baklava took a break in Turkey's pastry capital after the earthquake. Now it's back
SUMMARY: In a city known for its pistachio baklava, a pastry heavyweight turned his family's restaurant into a charity kitchen and shelter after the catastrophic Feb. 6 earthquake.

TITLE: Ukraine's birth rate was already dangerously low. Then war broke out
SUMMARY: The Russian invasion has cemented the decision for many couples to opt out of having babies, in a country that struggled with incredibly low fertility rates long before the war.

TITLE: Israeli raid leaves 11 dead and 100 wounded, Palestinians say, as violence rises
SUMMARY: The Israeli military says it was targeting a militant group in the West Bank called the Lion's Den. So far this year, at least 55 Palestinians â including civilians â have been killed.

TITLE: More than 2,300 flights canceled as heavy snow hits the Midwest
SUMMARY: Heavy snow and high winds are causing blizzard conditions in the Upper Midwest. It's the latest stage of a three-day storm that's placed over half the country under winter weather warnings.

TITLE: A look back at Oscar nominee Angela Bassett's long, distinguished career
SUMMARY: Angela Bassett has been nominated for a Best Actress Oscar for her role in <em>Black Panther: Wakanda Forever

TITLE: A doctor near East Palestine, Ohio, details the main thing he's watching for now
SUMMARY: Officials are monitoring the air and water in East Palestine, Ohio, since a train carrying chemicals derailed there. A local doctor tells us what he is seeing.

TITLE: Rapper Nipsey Hussle's killer is sentenced to 60 years to life in prison
SUMMARY: Eric R. Holder Jr. will likely remain in jail for the rest of his life for the murder of Nipsey Hussle, a beloved figure in south LA who was killed in 2019 outside his clothing store.

TITLE: Democrats are warning against the release of Jan. 6 tapes to a Fox News host
SUMMARY: After reports that Speaker Kevin McCarthy granted Fox News' Tucker Carlson access to the tapes, Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer slammed the move.

TITLE: More than 1,600 flights have been canceled as heavy snow hits the Midwest
SUMMARY: Heavy snow and high winds are causing blizzard conditions in the Upper Midwest. It's the latest stage of a three-day storm that's placed over half the country under winter weather warnings.

TITLE: A girl and a TV journalist were fatally shot near the scene of another shooting
SUMMARY: Authorities in Florida don't immediately have a motive for any of the shootings. A TV crewmember and the girl's mother were also wounded and in critical condition at the hospital.

TITLE: Unlikely alliances in Supreme Court opinions on overtime, death penalty
SUMMARY: The cases involved who qualifies for overtime pay, and Arizona's refusal to apply a Supreme Court precedent in death penalty jury instructions.

TITLE: Winter storm sending heavy snow where California rarely sees it
SUMMARY: The winter storm that's pummeling nearly half the United States means snow in parts of California that often don't see it.

TITLE: No cow needed: Oat and soy can be called milk, FDA proposes
SUMMARY: Food and Drug Administration officials have issued guidance that says plant-based beverages don't pretend to be from dairy animals â and that U.S. consumers aren't confused by the difference.

SUMMARY: Scott White's admission in the New South Wales state Supreme Court comes three months after he had his conviction for murdering Scott Johnson overturned by an appeals court.

TITLE: Putinology: the art of analyzing the man in the Kremlin
SUMMARY: They used to be called Kremlinologists â American experts on the Soviet Union. Now there's a new generation of Putinologists who seek to interpret Russia by analyzing its authoritarian leader.

TITLE: Deaths in custody are a crisis, but data on them is a black hole, a new report says
SUMMARY: A new report indicates that the federal government severely undercounts people who died while being transported, detained or arrested by law enforcement and those who died while incarcerated.

TITLE: After the Ukraine war, what comes next? NATO allies don't agree
SUMMARY: The military alliance is publicly committed to preserving Ukraine's independence. But discussions on how to reach that goal are quietly contentious.

TITLE: Red and blue states look to Medicaid to improve the health of people leaving prison
SUMMARY: People leaving jail or prison are at extremely high risk of hospitalization and death, and policymakers from deep blue California to solidly red Utah think bringing Medicaid behind bars could help.

TITLE: Americans want Congress to deal with the debt ceiling. How to do it is complicated
SUMMARY: A slim majority of respondents in the latest NPR/PBS NewsHour/Marist poll say the debt ceiling should be raised. But they split on whether to cut programs or raise taxes to reduce the national debt.

SUMMARY: A bill that would allow concealed weapons to be carried on West Virginia college campuses passed by a landslide in the state's House of Delegates. It heads to the desk of Republican Gov. Jim Justice.

TITLE: She's Ukrainian-American. Her relatives are in Russia. Family group texts are awkward
SUMMARY: For people who have family members on different sides of the war in Ukraine, it's been a long year of disagreeing, disbelieving and biting tongues.

TITLE: A proposed bill in Florida would ban dogs from hanging their heads out of car windows
SUMMARY: Dogs would not be able to hang their heads out of car windows under a new bill proposed in Florida. The bill would additionally ban cat declawing and cosmetic animal testing.

TITLE: Alex Murdaugh takes the stand to testify in his murder trial
SUMMARY: It's the latest dramatic shift in a case that has drawn attention because of the Murdaugh family's status as a wealthy and prominent family. Watch the testimony live.

SUMMARY: Spectrum News 13 confirmed that 24-year-old reporter Dylan Lyons was killed while covering a shooting on Wednesday, along with a 9-year-old girl. Her mom and a station photojournalist were injured.

SUMMARY: Murdaugh admitted on the stand that he lied about his alibi but said he did not kill his wife and son. It's the latest dramatic shift in a case involving the wealthy, prominent family. Watch live.

TITLE: R. Kelly sentenced to one more year in prison for child pornography
SUMMARY: The disgraced former R&B star is already serving 30 years for sex trafficking and racketeering. On Thursday, he was given one more year in prison for having made pornography with three children.

TITLE: How a former caterer created the mercenary army fighting Putin's war in Ukraine
SUMMARY: <em>Guardian

TITLE: Jimmy Carter took on the awful Guinea worm when no one else would â and he triumphed
SUMMARY: Carter targeted diseases primarily affecting the poor in remote areas â notably "Guinea worm disease." Because of his commitment, case numbers plummeted from 3.6 million a year to just 13 in 2022.

TITLE: Here's the most thorough explanation yet for the train derailment in East Palestine
SUMMARY: A wheel bearing on the train's 23rd car overheated to a dangerous degree, a new NTSB report says. Soon after, dozens of cars â including 11 carrying toxic chemicals â derailed near the Ohio town.

SUMMARY: Artist and collector Stephen Gamson was pointing out the porcelain balloon dog to his friend when the whole thing went down. It seems one gallery's trash is another man's treasure.

SUMMARY: Artist and collector Stephen Gamson was pointing out the porcelain balloon dog to his friend when the whole thing went down. It seems one gallery's trash is another man's treasure.

TITLE: China calls for a cease-fire and peace talks between Russia and Ukraine
SUMMARY: As Russia's war in Ukraine enters its second year, Beijing has repeatedly said it would broker any cease-fire talks, a <s>proposal

TITLE: Hybrid cars are still incredibly popular, but are they good for the environment?
SUMMARY: Shoppers are far more interested in hybrids than all-electric vehicles, but environmentalists believe cars like the Prius are an unnecessary detour on the path to electrification.

TITLE: Why an ulcer drug could be the last option for some abortion patients

SUMMARY: Since the first days of the space program, astronauts wear a special patch specific to each mission. A small North Carolina company has designed them all since the Apollo lunar launches.

SUMMARY: The Fairness Project has won campaigns to raise the minimum wage and expand Medicaid in nine states dominated by Republicans. Next is abortion. But there's growing pushback from state lawmakers.

SUMMARY: Jack Bittle's book takes a look at several communities that have been affected by climate change, and how the lives of their residents â those who have survived â have been altered by extreme weather.

SUMMARY: NPR photographer Claire Harbage shares her experiences of documenting life in Ukraine for the past year, amid the ongoing Russian invasion.

SUMMARY: Life in Russia and Ukraine has changed one year into the war. China wants the war to end as soon as possible. Plus, doctors are looking for options as an abortion medication's access is at risk.

TITLE: Friendships at work can boost happiness. Here's how to nurture them

TITLE: Why an ulcer drug could be the last option for many abortion patients
SUMMARY: Some abortion providers are looking to misoprostol, a medication widely used around the world, should a federal judge in Texas block access to a key medication abortion option.

SUMMARY: The continent's largest democracy and biggest economy holds a presidential election Saturday that's come down to a race of three leading candidates.

SUMMARY: "Fat," "ugly" and "horsey face" will remain in Roald Dahl's children's books in the U.K. after all. After a fierce backlash to proposed changes, Dahl's U.K. publisher announced a "classic collection."

SUMMARY: The home appliance brand Cosori received more than 200 reports of air fryers overheating, burning or melting â several of which led to minor burn injuries and property damage.

SUMMARY: Friday could be a pivotal day in the murder trial of disgraced South Carolina attorney Alex Murdaugh as he faces continued questioning from prosecutors.

SUMMARY: The launch comes a day after the U.S. and South Korea held tabletop exercises simulating a North Korean nuclear attack.

SUMMARY: The December ban on college education for women has led some to turn to online options. But that pption comes with its own set of problems.

TITLE: Remembering baseball announcer and former all-star catcher Tim McCarver
SUMMARY: McCarver, who died Feb. 16, played in the major leagues from 1959 until 1980. After retirement, he shifted to color commentary from the broadcast booth. <em>Originally broadcast in 1987.

SUMMARY: The science fiction and fantasy magazine Clarkesworld says it

TITLE: They were born into war. Now, they're celebrating their first birthday in the U.S.
SUMMARY: Twins Lenny and Moishe were born premature to a surrogate mother in Kyiv just as Russia began its attack on Ukraine. They went through a daring journey to reach their eventual home in Chicago.

TITLE: Democratic state attorneys general sue Biden administration over abortion pill rules
SUMMARY: The suit comes as a federal judge in another case is considering whether to overturn FDA approval of the same drug, mifepristone.

TITLE: California braces for winter storms as parts of the northern U.S. recover
SUMMARY: Major winter storms continue to hit parts of the U.S. â upending travel, closing roads, and leaving thousands of households in the dark.

TITLE: More than 2 million Cosori air fryers have been recalled over fire risks
SUMMARY: The home appliance brand Cosori received more than 200 reports of air fryers overheating, burning or melting â several of which led to minor burn injuries and property damage.

TITLE: On the stand, Alex Murdaugh denies the murders as prosecutors press him on his lies
SUMMARY: For hours on Friday, the lead prosecutor interrogated the disgraced South Carolina attorney over his lies about stealing money and his whereabouts the night his wife and son were killed in June 2021.

TITLE: Federal authorities are investigating another near runway collision between planes
SUMMARY: A Mesa Airlines jet was landing on the same runway a SkyWest plane was using to take off. It's the fourth such runway incursion over the last several weeks.

TITLE: Dead whales on the east coast fuel misinformation about offshore wind development
SUMMARY: Experts don't know what's behind the years-long trend of whale deaths. But there's no evidence connecting the deaths to offshore wind development, which is less noisy than fossil fuel exploration.

TITLE: After Russian forces occupied Kherson, ordinary citizens fought back from the shadows
SUMMARY: Residents of the Russian-speaking city became partisans who fought for the independence of Ukraine. The nine-month occupation is over, but Russia continues to shell the city.

TITLE: In East Palestine, who 'shows up' isn't necessarily a sign of who's helping
SUMMARY: East Palestine, Ohio, has been devastated by a train derailment and chemical burn off that has threatened the health of residents, but it has now also become the center of political controversy.

TITLE: Despite high inflation, Americans are spending like crazy â and it's kind of puzzling
SUMMARY: Americans began the new year with a spending spree, but businesses are not sure how long it can last. There's a lot riding on the answer, since consumer spending is the backbone of the U.S. economy.

TITLE: People smugglers keep trying to recruit this boat captain. Here's why he says no
SUMMARY: By day, Saint-Louis native Pape Dieye is a boat captain-turned-tour guide for a fancy hotel that caters to Westerners. By night, he turns down requests to smuggle human beings across the ocean.

TITLE: The key trends to watch in the Russia-Ukraine war
SUMMARY: Russia's military has performed poorly, and Ukraine has defied expectations. But will these trends hold? Experts look at how the war could take a different path in its second year.

TITLE: Italy has kept its fascist monuments and buildings. The reasons are complex
SUMMARY: Unlike Germany, which after World War II underwent a rigorous de-Nazification effort, pride, rather than shame, is the emotion many Italians feel for the symbols of the country's fascist past.

TITLE: Black married couples face heavier tax penalties than white couples, a report says
SUMMARY: The report is part of a growing body of research into whether institutions and policies reinforce preexisting racial disparities.

TITLE: Turkey's Antakya is in ruins after the quake, erasing cultural and religious heritage
SUMMARY: The city of Antakya, known in antiquity as Antioch, was at the crossroads of civilizations for centuries. After the Feb. 6 earthquake, many of its centuries-old monuments and sites lie in ruins.

TITLE: Five people died after an air ambulance crashed in western Nevada
SUMMARY: The airplane included a pilot, nurse, paramedic, a patient and family member of the patient. The cause of the crash has yet to be determined.

TITLE: Kherson's underground resistance: How ordinary people fought Russia from the shadows
SUMMARY: Residents of the Russian-speaking city became partisans who fought for the independence of Ukraine. The nine-month occupation is over, but Russia continues to shell the city.

TITLE: A major winter storm has prompted blizzard and flood warnings across California
SUMMARY: Blizzard warnings continued in the mountains and flood advisories blanketed the region, but forecasters offered some relief, predicting the storm would taper off later in the day on Saturday.

TITLE: FDA authorizes the first at-home test for COVID-19 and the flu
SUMMARY: The at-home nasal swab kit simultaneously tests for COVID-19 and two strains of the flu.

TITLE: University of Idaho to demolish off-campus home where 4 students were killed
SUMMARY: The university said it will tear down the King Street house in Moscow, Idaho, where a 28-year-old man killed four students in November.

TITLE: Snow blankets Los Angeles area in rare heavy storm
SUMMARY: Blizzard warnings continued in the mountains and flood advisories blanketed the region, on Saturday. Forecasters Sunday would bring some relief, before the next storm arrives on Monday.

TITLE: Nigerian election: votes are counted after bitterly fought election
SUMMARY: Nigerians went to the polls on Saturday in what many see as the most competitive election in decades.  But voting in some parts of the country did not go as smoothly as planned.

TITLE: Newspapers have dropped the Dilbert cartoon after racist comments by its creator
SUMMARY: The creator of the Dilbert comic strip faced a backlash of cancellations while defending remarks describing people who are Black as members of "a hate group".

TITLE: How to help young people limit screen time â and feel better about how they look
SUMMARY: New research found teens and young adults who even briefly cut time on social media gained self esteem. Try these 5 tips to help them â and yourself â improve screen-life balance.

TITLE: For Ukrainians in Dubai, a new restaurant offers a taste of home
SUMMARY: Ukrainian visitors and expats are flocking to Yoy restaurant for borsch, companionship and cultural events. Diners from Russia enjoy it too. The UAE has refused to pick sides in the Ukraine war.

TITLE: Disgraced FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried has another big problem: He won't shut up
SUMMARY: Most white-collar defendants lay low, but the ex-CEO of the collapsed cryptocurrency exchange FTX has been talking, tweeting, and sending email newsletters. Those comments could come back to hurt him.

TITLE: How a Supreme Court justice's paragraph put the Voting Rights Act in more danger

TITLE: Dozens of migrants have been killed in a shipwreck off the coast of Italy
SUMMARY: The Italian coast guard and firefighters have recovered more than 30 bodies after a wooden migrant boat broke apart in rough seas Sunday near the southern coast of Italy's mainland.

TITLE: Inside tent cities, Turkey's quake survivors wonder when they'll have a home again
SUMMARY: Some of those who lost their homes in the earthquakes that devastated southern Turkey still need tents - and dream of someday having a container to live in.

TITLE: Newspapers have dropped the 'Dilbert' comic strip after a racist rant by its creator
SUMMARY: The comic's creator, Scott Adams, said a recent opinion poll changed his mind about "helping Black Americans."

TITLE: Child labor violations are on the rise as some states look to loosen their rules
SUMMARY: The total number of violations is still much lower than it was two decades ago. But violations have more than tripled since 2015, a trend that has experts troubled.

TITLE: On the Kansas prairie, a master falconer develops a unique bond with birds of prey
SUMMARY: Monte Markley read <em>My Side of the Mountain

TITLE: Black farmers worry new approach on "race neutral" lending leaves them in the shadows
SUMMARY: White farmers' suits blocked a USDA program and led to a race neutral approach.

TITLE: Washington state attorney general says FDA rules on abortion drug are unreasonable
SUMMARY: A coalition of state attorneys general is suing the Food and Drug Administration over its regulation of mifepristone. NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Washington state Attorney General Bob Ferguson.

TITLE: The rights to a famed PSA of a crying Native American now held by an Indigenous group

TITLE: Israelis and Palestinians meet for talks on how to de-escalate recent wave of attacks

TITLE: EPA tells Norfolk Southern to temporarily stop shipping toxic train derailment waste

TITLE: Brittney Griner urges the return of U.S. detainees abroad at NAACP Image Awards
SUMMARY: In one of her first public appearances since her release from a Russian prison, Griner took the stage to thank everyone for their support and to remind the audience of those still detained abroad.

TITLE: At least 59 migrants have been killed in a shipwreck off the coast of Italy
SUMMARY: The Italian coast guard and firefighters have recovered dozens of bodies after a wooden migrant boat broke apart in rough seas Sunday near the southern coast of Italy's mainland.

TITLE: Congressman Henry Cuellar says Biden's rule to restrict asylum is 'reasonable'

SUMMARY: After months of scandal and controversy, the House has opened a formal probe to determine whether New York Rep. George Santos broke the law while lying to voters.

SUMMARY: The disgraced South Carolina lawyer was charged in the murders of his wife and son. His defense argued that investigators fabricated evidence. The prosecution said Murdaugh has told lie after lie.

SUMMARY: Residents who say they're still suffering from illnesses nearly a month after a train carrying toxic chemicals derailed in Ohio confronted the railroad's operator Thursday at a town forum.

SUMMARY: The documents in the Pentagon Papers told how U.S. involvement in the Vietnam War was built up steadily by political leaders and top military brass who were overconfident about U.S. prospects.

TITLE: Nordstrom says it will close its Canadian stores and cut 2,500 jobs
SUMMARY: Nordstrom chief executive Erik Nordstrom said the Seattle-based retailer is exiting Canada because it does not see a realistic path to profitability for the business in the country.

TITLE: A Maryland mayor has been arrested on more than 50 counts of child pornography
SUMMARY: Police were tipped off about a social media account posting child pornography in the county that was tracked back to Wojahn, who has been mayor of the city since 2015.

SUMMARY: The Texas GOP is pushing a bill that would punish district attorneys who set a policy not to prosecute certain crimes. It comes after many said they wouldn't go after abortion cases following <em>Dobbs

SUMMARY: New research suggests that vocal fry among toothed whales is what gives them the ability to echolocate, hunting down their prey with the loudest sounds produced by any animal on the planet.

TITLE: FDA has new leverage over companies looking for a quicker drug approval
SUMMARY: The Food and Drug Administration has new tools to hold drug companies accountable for promises they make about medications. But the agency has yet to show its hand in using this new power.

TITLE: Here's why it's hard to clean up toxic waste from the East Palestine train derailment
SUMMARY: Nearly two million gallons of wastewater and thousands of cubic yards of contaminated soil have already been removed from the site, with more to go. Every aspect of removal is governed by regulations.

SUMMARY: Ales Bialiatski was one of the leaders of Belarus' pro-democracy movement, inspiring protests against what activists maintained were fraudulent presidential elections in 2020.

SUMMARY: The production company A24 put the hit film's iconic costumes and hot dog hands on the block, with proceeds going to three groups. The priciest item, an animatronic raccoon, went for $90k.

SUMMARY: Dozens of the invasive behemoths, descended from 4 imported by the 1980s drug lord, are thriving in the region around his former ranch. Colombia wants to ship some of them to Mexico and India.

TITLE: Alex Murdaugh is sentenced to 2 life terms for the double murder of his wife and son
SUMMARY: The 54-year-old disbarred South Carolina lawyer insisted he was innocent, despite the judge pressing him to confess in open court.

SUMMARY: Researchers have found evidence of horseback riding in skeletal remains of people who lived about 5,000 years ago, adding to a body of research on when people first started using horses to get around.

SUMMARY: The park has been closed since Saturday as park crews work to restore critical services. Meanwhile, more heavy snow is forecast to fall over the park this weekend.

SUMMARY: The record breaks down to eight years, three months, and 13 days. And yes, it took some dedication. He coordinated the visits around dinner plans, work duties and travel.

TITLE: Biden had skin cancer removed from chest during his physical, White House says
SUMMARY: The results from a biopsy done on a skin lesion removed from President Biden's chest last month confirmed that the growth was basal cell carcinoma â a type of skin cancer that does not tend to spread.

SUMMARY: Before addiction consumed Tim Sizemore's career, he was a go-to character actor known for portraying tough guys in movies such as Heat and Saving Private Ryan

SUMMARY: NASA's Double Asteroid Redirection Test slammed a spacecraft into an asteroid, directly altering its path through space. Scientists are still studying the space rock to learn more.

SUMMARY: Funko, the maker of the Funko Pop! collectible figurines, will "eliminate" a massive batch of its inventory to alleviate some of the company's financial struggles.

SUMMARY: Outgoing premier Li Keqiang told delegates at the National People's Congress that China is aiming to rebound economically after COVID slowed them down

SUMMARY: On his way to Ukraine for an unannounced visit last week, Attorney General Merrick Garland spoke about the upholding the rule of law inside the U.S. and overseas in an exclusive interview with NPR.

SUMMARY: The U.S.-Russian-Japanese crew returned to Earth late Saturday after spending five months at the International Space Station, arriving last October.

TITLE: Israeli forces have killed three Palestinians in a shootout in the West Bank

TITLE: How law enforcement is promoting a troubling documentary about 'sextortion'
SUMMARY: Law enforcement organizations are promoting a new film about children being exploited into sharing sexual images and videos. But many of the film's key claims lack context.

TITLE: Very few architects are Black. This woman is pushing to change that

TITLE: After years of decline, the auto industry in Canada is making a comeback
SUMMARY: Ontario is one of the largest car producers in North America. But after years of job losses and plant closures, the Canadian province is now betting on electric vehicles to grow its auto sector.

TITLE: He was with Emmett Till the night he was murdered. The horror haunts him still
SUMMARY: The Rev. Wheeler Parker Jr. was just 16 years old when his cousin and best friend, Emmett Till, was lynched in 1955. Today, he is the last living witness of the kidnapping.

TITLE: How to watch the Oscars on Sunday night

TITLE: A months-long landfill fire in Alabama reveals waste regulation gaps
SUMMARY: An unregulated landfill that accepts vegetative waste has burned underground for months. Neighbors were inundated with smoke and left wondering why the site wasn't regulated in the first place.

TITLE: Asylum dreams remain elusive for tens of thousands of migrants bused to New York
SUMMARY: With limited work opportunities, they can't leave shelter programs or pay for immigration attorneys. The mayor and other officials says the cost has put a strain on the city budget.

TITLE: Four takeaways as oil giant Saudi Aramco reports a huge $161 billion profit

TITLE: Texas officials have told residents Mexico is too dangerous to visit for spring break

TITLE: At least 8 people are dead after 2 boats capsized off the San Diego shoreline
