SUMMARY: Democratic state officials say they're ready to dispense thousands of mifepristone doses if access to the pill becomes difficult as a result of a pending federal lawsuit.

TITLE: Photos: See how the Trump indictment day unfolded
SUMMARY: The former president has arrived at the criminal court to turn himself in for arraignment.

TITLE: Live updates: Donald Trump arraigned Tuesday in hush money payments case
SUMMARY: The former president and 2024 hopeful has been indicted by a grand jury, multiple sources close to Trump confirmed to NPR. Join NPR as we unpack key moments.

TITLE: Dogecoin price spikes after Elon Musk changes Twitter logo to the Shiba Inu dog
SUMMARY: Elon Musk is currently facing a $258 billion class-action federal lawsuit accusing him of engaging in a pyramid scheme for voicing his support for Dogecoin in several tweets.

TITLE: In a historic first, former President Donald Trump is charged with 34 felony counts
SUMMARY: The criminal charges â a historic first against a sitting or former president â are the culmination of an investigation into hush-money payments that Trump paid to cover up an alleged affair.

TITLE: What Trump's arraignment means for his 2024 election bid
SUMMARY: Fresh off a historic arraignment, former President Donald Trump is still very much running to regain office in 2024. This is the lay of the land for the weeks and months ahead.

TITLE: Live updates: Donald Trump pleads not guilty to 34 felony counts
SUMMARY: The former president and 2024 hopeful has been indicted by a grand jury, multiple sources close to Trump confirmed to NPR. Join NPR as we unpack key moments.

TITLE: Finland joins NATO over Russia's objection
SUMMARY: The Nordic nation's decision to join the defense alliance is seen as a blow to Russian President Vladimir Putin, but the Stimson Center's Emma Ashford argues it could have downsides for NATO too.

TITLE: After outcry, Jill Biden's office says White House invitation is for LSU women's team
SUMMARY: While it is tradition for the national champions to receive an invitation to visit the White House, runners up are not extended the same invite.

TITLE: For the first time in 15 years, liberals win control of the Wisconsin Supreme Court
SUMMARY: The Wisconsin Supreme Court could soon vote to legalize abortion and end gerrymandering now that Janet Protasiewicz, backed by Democrats, has defeated GOP-backed Dan Kelly for a seat on the bench.

TITLE: 5 things to know about Donald Trump's felony charges
SUMMARY: Former President Donald Trump has pleaded not guilty to 34 felony counts of falsifying business records to cover damaging information. Just getting up to speed on the news? Start here.

TITLE: Johnson & Johnson proposes paying $8.9 billion to settle talcum powder lawsuits
SUMMARY: Under a proposal, a J&J subsidiary will re-file for bankruptcy protection and seek court approval for a plan that would result in one of the largest product-liability settlements in U.S. history.

TITLE: Hawaii's lawmakers mull imposing fees to pay for ecotourism crush
SUMMARY: Hawaii lawmakers are considering legislation that would require tourists to pay for a yearlong license or pass to visit state parks and trails. They're still debating how much they would charge.

TITLE: Doctors are drowning in paperwork. Some companies claim AI can help
SUMMARY: New startups believe chatbot technology could help reduce the burden on physicians. But some academics warn bias and errors could hurt patients.

TITLE: A history of U.S. presidents and hush money payments
SUMMARY: The term hush money dates back centuries, and it's been applied to various scandals involving presidents for nearly as long as the U.S. has been a country.

TITLE: As Taiwan's President Tsai prepares to meet Kevin McCarthy, China is watching
SUMMARY: For President Tsai Ing-wen, the meeting will cap off a high-stakes trip intended to prove to voters that strengthening U.S. ties is worth the fallout, as Taipei's relations with China deteriorate.

TITLE: The big squeeze: ACA health insurance has lots of customers, small networks
SUMMARY: Some consumers who bought health insurance plans under the Affordable Care Act have had a tough start to the year: Many say it's hard to find an in-network doctor or hospital.

TITLE: Donald Trump lashes out, resorting to old tactics after arraignment hearing
SUMMARY: Donald Trump ripped from a well-worn page in his playbook Tuesday night â lashing out with a speech that was at times full of lies and conspiracies. And that's really no surprise.

TITLE: Laid off on leave: Yes, it's legal and it's hitting some workers hard
SUMMARY: The wave of layoffs in tech, media and elsewhere is affecting a sizable number of people who are out on medical or parental leave. While legal, it can make a bad situation even worse.

TITLE: A U.K. agency has fined TikTok nearly $16 million for handling of children's data
SUMMARY: The U.K.'s Information Commissioner's Office said there were up to 1.4 million children under the age of 13 on the app in 2020, despite TikTok's terms of service saying users must be 13 to sign up.

TITLE: Susanna Hoffs' 'This Bird Has Flown' is a love story â and a valentine to music
SUMMARY: Singer and guitarist Susanna Hoffs rose to fame with the Bangles in the 1980s. With her new book, she proves her immense writing talent isn't just confined to songs.

TITLE: Check out the deepest-swimming fish ever caught on camera
SUMMARY: The unknown snailfish species, of the genus <em>Pseudoliparis

TITLE: Georgia lawmakers add to the growing list of bans on outside election funding
SUMMARY: Georgia Republicans are set to ban local officials from seeking almost all third-party funding to help cover election costs. It comes as election officials complain about persistent funding needs.

TITLE: DOJ reaches settlement with families of Sutherland Springs mass shooting
SUMMARY: The department announced it had reached a tentative settlement of $144.5 million, ending a legal back-and-forth that has lasted years.

TITLE: Volkswagen recalls 143,000 Atlas SUVs due to problems with the front passenger airbag
SUMMARY: Faulty wiring in a weight sensor on the front passenger side of some Atlases can switch off the airbag. Owners shouldn't let people ride in that seat until the problem can be corrected, VW advised.

TITLE: At least 4 people are dead after a tornado tore through Missouri
SUMMARY: A large tornado hit southeastern Missouri before dawn, causing widespread destruction as a broad swath of the Midwest and South braced for further storms that could spawn additional twisters and hail.

TITLE: Twitter labels NPR's account as 'state-affiliated media', which is untrue
SUMMARY: NPR operates independently of the U.S. government. NPR has asked Twitter to remove the label, calling it "unacceptable." But the company's CEO, Elon Musk, says it "seems accurate."

TITLE: Maryland attorney general releases report on decades of sex abuse by Catholic priests
SUMMARY: The redacted report paints a damning picture of abuse allegations against nearly 160 priests, involving more than 600 victims and spanning 80 years, and the Archdiocese of Baltimore's response.

TITLE: Judge orders Stormy Daniels to pay Donald Trump another $120,000 in legal fees
SUMMARY: A federal judge ruled in favor of the former president on Tuesday, ordering adult film star Stormy Daniels to pay another $121,972 in legal fees for a failed defamation suit.

TITLE: The EPA proposes tighter limits on toxic emissions from coal-fired power plants
SUMMARY: The rules would lower emissions of mercury and other toxic pollutants that can harm brain development of young children and contribute to heart attacks and other health problems in adults.

TITLE: At least 5 people are dead after a tornado tore through Missouri
SUMMARY: A large tornado hit southeastern Missouri before dawn, causing widespread destruction as a broad swath of the Midwest and South braced for further storms that could spawn additional twisters and hail.

TITLE: Some Jews keep a place empty at Seder tables for a jailed journalist in Russia
SUMMARY: As Jewish people around the world celebrate Passover,  some plan to leave a seat open at their Seders for a Wall Street Journal reporter recently jailed in Russia.

TITLE: Pence won't appeal judge's ruling, paving the way for his testimony in Justice probe
SUMMARY: When the former vice president will testify is unclear, though former President Donald Trump could appeal the ruling by Judge James Boasberg that ordered Pence to appear before the grand jury.

TITLE: He felt the slither of a venomous snake in the cockpit â then turned the plane around
SUMMARY: South African pilot Rudolf Erasmus made an emergency landing after discovering a Cape cobra accompanying him in the cockpit on Monday. The snake has not been found again since the plane landed.

TITLE: Twitter labels NPR's account as 'state-affiliated media,' which is untrue
SUMMARY: NPR operates independently of the U.S. government. NPR has asked Twitter to remove the label, calling it "unacceptable." But Twitter CEO Elon Musk says it "seems accurate."

TITLE: Cash App creator Bob Lee, 43, is killed in San Francisco
SUMMARY: Lee, a technology executive who created Cash App and was currently chief product officer of MobileCoin, was fatally stabbed in San Francisco, according to the cryptocurrency platform and police.

TITLE: Catan board game creator Klaus Teuber dies at 70
SUMMARY: Teuber created the hugely popular game in which players compete to build settlements on a fictional island. Since its 1995 debut, it has sold tens of millions of copies in more than 40 languages.

TITLE: The royals dropped 'consort' from Queen Camilla's title. What's the big deal?
SUMMARY: The invitation to King Charles' May coronation refers to his wife as Queen Camilla, dropping the word 'consort.' Royal experts unpack the significance of the title and the history behind it.

TITLE: Stacey Abrams is chosen as Howard University's first chair for race and Black politics
SUMMARY: In her new role, Abrams will lead research across the university on political issues impacting Black Americans. She begins her multi-year appointment at the University starting this September.

TITLE: A N.C. lawmaker has switched parties, creating a path to stricter abortion laws
SUMMARY: North Carolina state Rep. Tricia Cotham announced she was switching affiliation on Wednesday â a move that gives the Republicans a veto-proof majority in the state.

TITLE: Klaus Teuber, Catan board game creator, dies at 70
SUMMARY: Teuber created the hugely popular game in which players compete to build settlements on a fictional island. Since its 1995 debut, it has sold tens of millions of copies in more than 40 languages.

TITLE: Chipotle and Sweetgreen have beef over a chicken burrito bowlânow it's going to court
SUMMARY: Chipotle argues that Sweetgreen is attempting to profit off of the burrito chain's near-identical, directly competitive and well-known "Chipotle Chicken Burrito Bowl."

TITLE: The governors from Indiana and Idaho sign bans on gender-affirming care
SUMMARY: Governors in Indiana and Idaho sign into law bills banning gender-affirming care for minors, as Republican-led legislatures continue to curb LGBTQ+ rights this year.

TITLE: A man accused of dealing drugs that led to Michael K. Williams' death pleads guilty
SUMMARY: Irvin Cartagena, 39, allegedly sold fentanyl-laced drugs to an undercover NYPD officer on several occasions. Narcotics found in William's apartment were linked back to Cartagena, police say.

TITLE: 'The House Is on Fire' spotlights privilege, sexism, and racism in the 1800s
SUMMARY: Rachel Beanland's historical novel chronicles the burning of a theater and its aftermath in Virginia in 1811, while also tackling the rampant racism and misogyny of the times in the process.

TITLE: 5 new YA books that explore the magic of the arts and the art of magic
SUMMARY: Art and magic so often go hand in hand. These new YA releases all explore both art and magic as the means to heal trauma, communities â and even worlds.

TITLE: The price of a ballot signature is way up, and experts worry it's encouraging fraud
SUMMARY: A scandal affecting Michigan Republicans last year highlighted instances of suspected fraud in the signature-gathering process. Some states are now looking to crack down on bad actors.

TITLE: Golf has a problem: people are hitting the ball too far
SUMMARY: There's a storm brewing in the golf world over how far the best players are able to pound the ball. The proposed solution isn't winning over many fans either.

TITLE: Airline passengers could be in for a rougher ride, thanks to climate change
SUMMARY: Research in recent years has pointed to more incidents of clear-air turbulence in the jet stream brought on by rising temperatures. Airline crews and passengers are feeling the effects firsthand.

TITLE: Top Saudi and Iranian envoys meet in China for a deal that could remake the region
SUMMARY: Their first high-level public meeting in years was held in China, which brokered an agreement last month

TITLE: America's roads are more dangerous, as police pull over fewer drivers
SUMMARY: The fatality rate on America's roads remains higher than before the pandemic, and some blame the increase on less traffic policing

TITLE: Hundreds of thousands lose power as freezing rain hits Ontario and Quebec
SUMMARY: Freezing rain and thunderstorms pummeled parts of Ontario and Quebec on Wednesday, knocking out power for about 800,000 people, officials reported.

TITLE: Morning news brief
SUMMARY: Saudi Arabia and Iran work to normalize relations. For a second day, Israeli police clash with Palestinians. Tennessee House to decide whether to expel three Democratic lawmakers for violating rules.

TITLE: Auschwitz Memorial calls WWE 'shameless' for using its image in a match promo
SUMMARY: A shot of the Nazi concentration camp appeared briefly in a shot promoting a match between Dominik and Rey Mysterio on Saturday. The Auschwitz Memorial called the move "shameless."

TITLE: Debris is found during a search for a Japanese army helicopter carrying 10
SUMMARY: A missing Black Hawk carrying 10 crew members is believed to have crashed into the sea off a southern island after objects appearing to be aircraft parts were spotted in the area, an official said.

TITLE: Supreme Court declines to intervene in West Virginia trans law battle
SUMMARY: The state's law was challenged by a 12-year-old  transgender girl named Becky Pepper-Jackson, who has lived as a girl since fourth grade, according to court papers.

TITLE: Feds barged into the wrong hotel room during a drill, then detained the guest inside
SUMMARY: U.S. Army Special Operations Command and the FBI-Boston Division interrogated the wrong person during a training exercise on Tuesday: an airline pilot who was asleep at the time, per local media.

TITLE: A Good Friday funeral in Texas. Baby Halo's parents had few choices in post-Roe Texas
SUMMARY: When she gave birth to her baby with a fatal condition two months early, Samantha Casiano scrambled to raise funds for the funeral. Anti-abortion advocates say Texas laws are "working as designed."

TITLE: A Biden administration review of Afghanistan withdrawal blames Trump
SUMMARY: The review blames the "conditions created by his predecessor" for the way the U.S. ended its more than two-decade-long military presence in Afghanistan. It is being sent to Congress today.

TITLE: What to know as the Tennessee House votes on expelling 3 Democrats
SUMMARY: Republicans say the trio's protest over gun laws amounted to an insurrection. Reps. Gloria Johnson, Justin Jones and Justin Pearson face a disciplinary measure used only twice since the 1800s.

TITLE: New Zealand's Jacinda Ardern takes on a new role after leaving politics this week
SUMMARY: In a rousing and personal farewell speech this week in parliament, the former prime minister touched on family, politics and one of the very few things she will ask of her colleagues as she departs.

TITLE: FDA pulls the only approved drug for preventing premature birth off the market
SUMMARY: The drug had been fast-tracked for approval under the agency's accelerated approval program, and has been available for more than a decade, despite the drugmaker's failure to prove that it works.

TITLE: Supreme Court won't enforce West Virginia law banning trans athletes from girls' teams
SUMMARY: The state's law was challenged by a 12-year-old  transgender girl named Becky Pepper-Jackson, who has lived as a girl since fourth grade, according to court papers.

TITLE: The Biden administration moves to make broad, transgender sports bans illegal
SUMMARY: The proposed changes to Title IX would still give schools some flexibility to ban transgender athletes depending on age and sport.

TITLE: Tennessee House votes to expel the first of 3 Democratic members over gun protest
SUMMARY: The Republican-led House voted to remove Rep. Justin Jones of Nashville after a protest on the floor of the chamber over gun laws. The House has yet to determine the fate of two other Democrats.

TITLE: Tennessee House votes not to expel a second Democratic member over gun protest
SUMMARY: The Republican-led House voted to not to expel Rep. Gloria Johnson hours after it decided to remove Justin Jones. The two were part of a protest on the floor over gun laws.

TITLE: Elon Musk says NPR's 'state affiliated media' label might not have been accurate
SUMMARY: In a series of emails with an NPR reporter, the CEO of Twitter suggested that the designation is being re-examined, but it has not yet been removed.

TITLE: A new solar energy deal will bring power to 140,000 homes and businesses in 3 states
SUMMARY: The agreement calls for Qcells and Virginia-based Summit Ridge Energy to deploy community solar projects capable of generating 1.2 gigawatts of electricity in Illinois, Maine and Maryland.

TITLE: Tennessee House votes to expel 2 of 3 Democratic members over gun protest
SUMMARY: The Republican-led House voted to expel Reps. Justin Jones and Justin Pearson for participating in a protest on the floor of the House over gun laws. A motion to remove Rep. Gloria Johnson failed.

TITLE: Elon Musk says NPR's 'state-affiliated media' label might not have been accurate
SUMMARY: In a series of emails with an NPR reporter, the CEO of Twitter suggested that the designation is being re-examined, but it has not yet been removed.

TITLE: Israel strikes Lebanon and Gaza following militant rocket fire
SUMMARY: The Israeli strikes on Lebanon â called the most serious border violence since Israel's 2006 war with Lebanon's Hezbollah militant group â threatened to push the conflict into a dangerous new phase.

TITLE: A fatal mistake: The truth behind a Marine Corps lie and broken promises
SUMMARY: A mortar blast killed two Marines in Iraq almost 20 years ago. But families weren't told for years it was "friendly fire," a tragic accident, despite regulations. Some of the wounded were never told.

TITLE: Live Easter reenactments resume in the Philippines despite Catholic Church objections
SUMMARY: The real-life reenactments in the farming village of San Pedro Cutud in Pampanga province north of Manila resumed after a three-year pause because of the coronavirus pandemic.

TITLE: Newly elected United Auto Workers leader strikes militant tone ahead of contract talks
SUMMARY: The UAW has a new president, Shawn Fain, who is promising a return to aggressive political activity by the union, along with a tougher approach with auto companies.

TITLE: Clinics offering abortions face a rise in threats, violence and legal battles
SUMMARY: Since the U.S. Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade, medical providers are encountering more legal and political battles â and escalating threats from the anti-abortion movement.

TITLE: How an unknown navigator helped Julie in her moment of need
SUMMARY: Julie's husband was always her navigator on road trips. After he died, Julie got lost on her first trip without him. She started to panic, until a kind stranger helped her get back on track.

TITLE: How 'Abbott Elementary' helps teachers process the absurd realities of their job
SUMMARY: Set in Philadelphia, the award-winning sitcom finds humor in the struggles of teaching in an under-resourced school district. Real-life Philly teachers tell NPR there's truth in every joke.

TITLE: Israeli medics say 2 killed in an attack in the West Bank
SUMMARY: An alleged shooting attack in the northern occupied West Bank killed two women and seriously wounded another, Israeli medics said on Friday.

TITLE: No, the IRS isn't calling you. It isn't texting or emailing you, either
SUMMARY: Since 2018, over 75,000 victims have lost $28 million to IRS imposters over the phone, email, texts and more. Here's how the IRS actually contacts taxpayers and how you can spot imposters.

TITLE: Israeli medics say 2 are killed in an attack in the West Bank
SUMMARY: An alleged shooting attack in the northern occupied West Bank killed two women and seriously wounded another, Israeli medics said on Friday.

TITLE: The job market is cooling as higher interest rates and a slowing economy take a toll
SUMMARY: U.S. employers added 236,000 jobs in March as hiring slowed from the previous month. Unemployment dipped to 3.5%, from 3.6% in February.

TITLE: Coolio died of an accidental fentanyl overdose, coroner's report shows
SUMMARY: Coolio died on Sept. 28, 2022, at a friend's home in Los Angeles. The 59-year-old rapper's cause of death was unknown at the time.

TITLE: Tennessee state Rep. Justin Jones responds to his expulsion from the House
SUMMARY: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Tennessee state Rep. Justin Jones. He is one of two Democratic lawmakers who was expelled from the state House over a protest in favor of gun regulations.

TITLE: Justice Thomas explains why he didn't report trips paid for by billionaire
SUMMARY: Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas responded to a news report about his failure to disclose trips paid for by a conservative billionaire friend, saying he had been advised they were not reportable.

TITLE: Stormy Daniels says she's not yet 'vindicated' by Trump's indictment
SUMMARY: The adult film star told TalkTV's Piers Morgan she's looking forward to possibly testifying in Trump's trial after the Manhattan district attorney charged him with falsifying business records.

TITLE: Former Tennessee Rep. Justin Jones says he lost a seat, but voters lost their voice
SUMMARY: Jones, one of two Black Democrats expelled from the state House, tells NPR he's keeping his options open and would "most definitely" demand his seat back if local officials reappointed him to it.

TITLE: California salmon fishing slated to shut down this year due to low stock
SUMMARY: Federal researchers expect a near-record-low stock of Chinook salmon, one of the largest and most highly prized fish in the Pacific Ocean.

TITLE: 3 new Star Wars live-action films are coming
SUMMARY: The upcoming releases will span the dawn of the Jedi to the events after Rise of Skywalker and close out the interconnected stories told in The Mandalorian

TITLE: Denise Lajimodiere is named North Dakota's first Native American poet laureate
SUMMARY: A citizen of the Turtle Mountain band of Chippewa Indians, Lajimodiere has written several award-winning books of poetry and is an expert on the history of Native American boarding schools.

TITLE: Top-secret Pentagon documents on Ukraine war appear on social media
SUMMARY: Maps and charts providing details on Ukraine's military and the state of the war have been published on Twitter and Telegram. The Pentagon says it is investigating how they were leaked or stolen.

TITLE: Nebraska hasn't passed a single bill this session, amid filibusters over trans rights
SUMMARY: A state senator has vowed to "burn this session to the ground" in protest to a bill that would bar physicians from providing gender affirming care to people under 19 years old.

TITLE: A Utah ice climber was killed by falling ice after saving her friend's life
SUMMARY: Meg O'Neill, a mentor to young refugees, died after pushing a young woman into safety. They were ascending the frozen Raven Falls in Utah with another climber when the ice cracked, police said.

TITLE: Did the last census overcount Asian Americans? It depends on where you look
SUMMARY: The U.S. Census Bureau said there was a national overcount of Asian Americans in its 2020 tally. But a new report finds Asian Americans may have also been left out of some state and county numbers.

TITLE: After Tennessee House Republicans expelled 2 Democrats, will other states follow?
SUMMARY: It's a rare occurrence, but the expulsion of two Black lawmakers from Tennessee's Republican-led House highlights a new level of "democratic dysfunction," a constitutional law expert tells NPR.

TITLE: U.S. judge says FDA wrongly approved key abortion pill, putting access in jeopardy
SUMMARY: A federal judge in Texas stayed the FDA's approval of the drug mifepristone and gave the government a week to seek relief from an appeals court.

TITLE: Judges' dueling decisions put access to a key abortion drug in jeopardy nationwide
SUMMARY: A federal judge in Texas stayed the FDA's approval of the drug mifepristone, while a federal judge in Washington state has blocked any FDA change in access.

TITLE: Former model accuses onetime Harvey Weinstein associate of sexual assault
SUMMARY: Fabrizio Lombardo was head of Miramax Italy, an European branch of the film company cofounded by Harvey Weinstein.

TITLE: Pope Francis skips traditional Good Friday procession at the Colosseum in chilly Rome
SUMMARY: Pope Francis, hospitalized recently with bronchitis, skipped the procession because of cold weather. It was the first time a pope was a no-show at the Colosseum Way of the Cross procession since 2005.

TITLE: Avian flu has killed 3 California condors in northern Arizona
SUMMARY: Authorities are trying to determine what killed five others in the flock. The California condor population fell to near extinction in the '70s, but the total wild population now numbers more than 300.

TITLE: China flies fighter jets near Taiwan after the leader's trip to the U.S.
SUMMARY: China sent warships and dozens of fighter jets toward Taiwan on Saturday, Taiwanese officials said. The move follows a meeting between the U.S. speaker of the House and the president of Taiwan.

TITLE: A California bill would create an alert system for missing Black women and youth
SUMMARY: A proposed "Ebony Alert" system, similar to an Amber or Silver alert, would inform people of missing Black children and young women. The plan aims to bring attention to these often overlooked groups.

TITLE: Trump wasn't put under a gag order, but he was told to watch his words
SUMMARY: Gag orders ride a fine line between balancing the right to free speech and to a fair trial. They restrict what trial participants can and cannot say outside of court.

TITLE: Why K-pop's future is in crisis, according to its chief guardian
SUMMARY: The chief producer behind BTS says K-pop is in crisis as global sales slow or decline â and BTS' taking a break is a big factor. But the industry is trying to pick itself back up.

TITLE: College dreams and teen love find common ground in 'Promposal'
SUMMARY: In RaeChell Garrett's delightful YA book, a Black teen entrepreneur launches a start-up where she is paid to help conceive and execute elaborate prom date proposals for fellow classmates.

TITLE: More pollen, more allergies: Exposure therapy in several forms treats symptoms
SUMMARY: Some doctors prescribe sublingual immunotherapy, known as SLIT, a serum taken as drops under the tongue. Patients like it, but it is not FDA-approved, so insurance usually doesn't cover it.

TITLE: Pentagon, Justice Department investigate as secret military documents appear online
SUMMARY: Dozens of classified U.S. documents detailing the war in Ukraine have appeared on multiple social media sites. There's no word on who might be responsible for leaking or stealing the material.

TITLE: An Israeli police raid on the Al-Aqsa Mosque triggers a spate of violence
SUMMARY: The escalating conflict in Israel and the occupied territories has played out against a backdrop of religious celebrations â Ramadan for Muslims, Passover for Jews and Easter for Christians.

TITLE: Texas governor seeks to pardon Army sergeant convicted of murder
SUMMARY: Army Sgt. Daniel Perry was convicted of murder for fatally shooting an armed protester in 2020 during nationwide protests against police violence and racial injustice, a Texas jury ruled Friday.

TITLE: L.A. school district workers have approved a labor deal following a 3-day strike
SUMMARY: The agreement would increase wages by 30% for workers who are paid an average of $25,000 a year, SEIU Local 99 said. The contract still needs approval from the school district's Board of Education.

TITLE: Ben Ferencz, the last living Nuremberg prosecutor of Nazis, has died at 103
SUMMARY: Ben Ferencz tried Nazis for genocidal war crimes and was among the first outside witnesses to document the atrocities of Nazi labor and concentration camps.

TITLE: 2 Wisconsin police officers killed in traffic stop shooting
SUMMARY: The Wisconsin Department of Justice said in a statement late Saturday that it was investigating the shooting in Cameron, Wisconsin. The suspect in the shooting was taken to a hospital and later died.

TITLE: Israeli military retaliates after rockets fired from Syria
SUMMARY: The Israeli military said its forces attacked targets in Syria after six rockets were launched from Syrian territory in two batches toward Israel in a rare attack from Israel's northeastern neighbor.

TITLE: Poetry-loving Biden heads to Ireland, home of the 'best poets in the world'
SUMMARY: President Biden's penchant for Irish poetry is likely to come through during his upcoming visit to the Emerald Isle, where he'll mark the anniversary of the Good Friday Agreement.

TITLE: What to know about the Trump-E. Jean Carroll trial that is set to begin this month
SUMMARY: In 2019, Carroll accused Trump of raping her in a department store in the mid-1990s and later sued him for battery and defamation for his denials. The first of two trials is set to begin April 25.

TITLE: Mostly through images, a daughter grieves her mother in 'Ephemera'
SUMMARY: Briana Loewinsohn's graphic novel presents a fully developed internal, and external, landscape without leaning heavily on words. It's a sophisticated exploration of the weight adults carry around.

TITLE: Businesses face more and more pressure from investors to act on climate change
SUMMARY: At annual meetings this spring, shareholders will be pushing publicly-traded companies for information about how they're contributing to climate change, and what they're doing about the problem.

TITLE: This doctor fought Ebola in the trenches. Now he's got a better way to stop diseases
SUMMARY: Dr. Daniel Bausch says of his work, "You realize that's all on the response side." He's come to appreciate that "the impact is with trying to change the system."

TITLE: Credit crackdown weighs on businesses
SUMMARY: Even before the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank last month, other banks were getting stingier about making loans. That makes it harder for businesses trying to grow and raises the risk of recession.

TITLE: Chelsea Manning had to fight to transition in prison. She wants better for others
SUMMARY: Manning first came to public scrutiny â and was incarcerated â over her participation with WikiLeaks. She aims to use that attention to shed light on the struggles trans people face in U.S. prisons.

TITLE: In the pope's Easter address, a call to pray for Ukrainians, Russians and refugees
SUMMARY: Pope Francis, along with dozens of prelates and tens of thousands of faithful, celebrated Easter Mass in a flower-adorned St. Peter's Square.

TITLE: Tiger Woods has withdrawn from the Masters over a plantar fasciitis injury
SUMMARY: The five-time Masters champion completed seven holes of his third round on Saturday before play was called off due to inclement weather.

TITLE: Mark your calendars! A total solar eclipse is coming one year from now
SUMMARY: Viewers located in a strip of the mainland U.S. stretching from Texas to Maine will be able to see the moon pass directly in front of the afternoon sun.

TITLE: 8 people are missing after a building exploded and collapsed in Marseille, France
SUMMARY: Firefighters, with the help of urban rescue experts, worked through the night and all day in a slow race against time to find victims.

TITLE: A Major League Soccer player said an opponent made a racist remark during a game
SUMMARY: The New York Red Bulls said the team would cooperate with the league's investigation into one of its players.

TITLE: Saudi officials visit Yemen's capital for talks with rebels
SUMMARY: Saudi officials were in Yemen's capital Sunday for talks with the Iran-backed Houthi rebels, as part of international efforts to find a settlement to Yemen's nine-year conflict, officials said.

TITLE: NBA coach Gregg Popovich criticizes lawmakers over gun control
SUMMARY: Popovich, who has coached the Spurs for 27 years, has been outpsoken on issues of gun control, race and LGBTQ+ rights over the years.

TITLE: 2 bodies are found after a building exploded and collapsed in Marseille, France
SUMMARY: Firefighters, with the help of urban rescue experts, worked through the night and all day in a slow race against time to find victims.

TITLE: Meet the chief federal judge overseeing several high-profile Trump grand jury probes
SUMMARY: Jeb Boasberg is taking over as chief judge of the federal district court in Washington as grand jury investigations of former President Trump intensify.

TITLE: Why a portrait artist from Ireland started making comics about U.S. police brutality
SUMMARY: Ireland-based artist Pan Cooke creates cartoons summarizing the world's daily news in comics, highlighting how prevalent police brutality and hate crimes are across the U.S.

TITLE: Local officials are poised to send expelled Tennessee lawmakers back to state House
SUMMARY: Former Reps. Justin Jones, D-Nashville, and Justin Pearson, D-Memphis, want to return to the House. Upcoming meetings could give local officials the chance to send them back.

TITLE: Strep is bad right now â an antibiotic shortage is making it worse
SUMMARY: Strep throat is more prevalent this year, and amoxicillin manufacturers didn't make enough of the antibiotic to go around.

TITLE: Thousands of faculty across 3 unions at Rutgers University are expected to strike
SUMMARY: The unions represent at least 8,000 full-time faculty, adjunct professors, counselors and graduate workers.

TITLE: 2 people are dead, 20 missing, as a migrant boat sinks off the coast of Tunisia
SUMMARY: The boat sank over the weekend in the Mediterranean Sea between Tunisia and Italy. About 25 people were rescued. Thousands of migrants have reached Italy's tiny Lampedusa island in the past few days.

TITLE: 5 people are dead and 6 are injured after a shooting in downtown Louisville
SUMMARY: Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear said he was heading to the scene. "Please pray for all of the families impacted and for the city of Louisville," he said.

TITLE: The Dalai Lama apologizes for asking a young boy to suck his tongue
SUMMARY: The 87-year-old Buddhist high priest says he "regrets" kissing a young boy on the lips and asking him to "suck my tongue." A video capturing the incident went viral on social media, sparking outrage.

TITLE: The dream of wiping out polio might need a rethink
SUMMARY: When public health specialists look at the annual case counts, some see a trend that raises questions about how realistic the goal of a polio-free world might be.

TITLE: Former DOJ official Brandon Van Grack discusses leaks of classified info on Ukraine
SUMMARY: NPR's A Martinez speaks with Brandon Van Grack about the leak of classified information on Ukraine. When he was at the Justice Department, Van Grack led the investigation into Edward Snowden.

TITLE: Rutgers University faculty members are striking over a contract dispute
SUMMARY: The three unions say they have been unable to reach an agreement with university officials. Rutgers president Jonathan Holloway said he was disappointed by the strike.

TITLE: Latest on Ukraine: Pentagon leaks, France's overtures in China and Finland in NATO
SUMMARY: Catch up on key developments and the latest in-depth coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

TITLE: Medication abortion is still possible with just one drug. Here's how it works
SUMMARY: A judge's ruling puts access to the abortion drug mifepristone in limbo, pending further court decisions. But there's another drug that is safe and effective at ending early pregnancy.

TITLE: 5 people are dead and 8 are injured after a shooting in downtown Louisville
SUMMARY: Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear said he was heading to the scene. "Please pray for all of the families impacted and for the city of Louisville," he said.

SUMMARY: Brandon Van Grack, who led the Justice Department's probe into Edward Snowden, says the priority has to be finding the source of the leak and ensuring there aren't any more coming.

SUMMARY: An imam in the city of Paterson was stabbed while leading his congregation in prayer on Sunday. When police arrived, the attacker was already apprehended by congregants.

SUMMARY: Sgt. Daniel Perry hasn't been sentenced in the killing of Garrett Foster. But the pardons board is already starting to review his case, at Texas Gov. Greg Abbott's request.

SUMMARY: Access to mifepristone, a medication that is used in about half of all abortions nationwide, hangs in the balance of two contradictory court rulings. A date with the Supreme Court is all but certain.

SUMMARY: The White House unveiled new bunny costumes, received commemorative eggs from egg growers and students and hosted 30,000 visitors to participate in the roll and other education-themed activities.

SUMMARY: A Texas man is suing three women he says helped his ex-wife obtain an abortion "without even his knowledge." Experts say documents related to the case suggest he might have known ahead of time.

SUMMARY: The hearing â which will happen "in the coming days," says Sen. Dick Durbin â comes in the wake of a news report about lavish trips Justice Clarence Thomas took from a friend but did not disclose.

TITLE: How America's largest newspaper company is leaving behind news deserts
SUMMARY: The country's largest newspaper company, Gannett, is once again forecasting it will sell off more of its daily newspapers. It's prompting fears of news deserts and a weakened democracy.

TITLE: Tennessee Rep. Justin Jones unanimously reappointed to House by Nashville Council
SUMMARY: Tennessee state Rep. Justin Jones, who was expelled from the state House last week alongside former Rep. Justin Pearson of Memphis, was reinstated to his seat Monday on an interim basis.

TITLE: Al Jaffee, longtime 'Mad Magazine' cartoonist, dies at 102
SUMMARY: Mad Magazine's

TITLE: Tennessee Rep. Justin Jones returns to Capitol after Nashville Council reinstates him
SUMMARY: Tennessee state Rep. Justin Jones, who was expelled from the state House last week alongside former Rep. Justin Pearson of Memphis, was reinstated to his seat Monday on an interim basis.

TITLE: 5 people are dead and 9 are injured after a shooting in downtown Louisville
SUMMARY: The 25-year-old gunman was an employee of the bank and was shot and killed by police. An officer who had just graduated from the police academy was among those wounded after he was shot in the head.

TITLE: 6 people are dead and 8 are injured after a shooting in downtown Louisville
SUMMARY: The 25-year-old gunman was an employee of the bank and was shot and killed by police. An officer who had just graduated from the police academy was among those wounded after he was shot in the head.

TITLE: Hundreds flee from wildfire in South Korean seaside city
SUMMARY: Hundreds of South Koreans were forced to flee a wildfire fueled by strong winds that burned parts of an eastern coastal city Tuesday, destroying dozens of homes.

TITLE: Biden ends COVID national emergency after Congress acts
SUMMARY: The U.S. national emergency to respond to the COVID-19 pandemic ended Monday as President Joe Biden signed a bipartisan congressional resolution to bring it to a close after three years.

TITLE: The mom of the 6-year-old who shot his teacher is being charged with child neglect
SUMMARY: The child has not been charged in the shooting of Abby Zwerner, 25, a teacher at Richneck Elementary School in Newport News, Virginia.

TITLE: A judge rules that Elizabeth Holmes cannot remain free during appeal
SUMMARY: Theranos founder Elizabeth Holmes was convicted of wire fraud and conspiracy to commit wire fraud last year and sentenced to 11 years in prison.

TITLE: One camp at a time, a Seattle group is transforming its approach to homelessness
SUMMARY: During the pandemic, a nonprofit in Seattle took a different approach to solving homelessness: helping whole encampments of unhoused people themselves make a plan to get housing.

SUMMARY: This Iraqi man says that 20 years after appearing in a notorious photo in U.S. detention in Abu Ghraib prison, his family lives in shame and poverty, never receiving U.S. compensation or apologies.

SUMMARY: President Biden's trip marking the 25th anniversary of the Good Friday Agreement is part diplomacy and part homecoming.

TITLE: Texas residents wait and watch as a sinkhole in their town grows
SUMMARY: A huge sinkhole that seemed stable for 15 years suddenly began expanding about a week ago, growing by several acres and leaving nearby residents terrified that it will take them and their homes.

TITLE: More than half of Americans have dealt with gun violence in their personal lives
SUMMARY: A national poll finds that a majority of Americans have felt the effects of gun violence in their personal lives.

TITLE: A smart move on tax day: Sign up for health insurance using your state's tax forms
SUMMARY: Paying taxes can be agonizing. So can shopping for health insurance. But a handful of states have made enrolling in subsidized or free coverage a little easier for people when they file their taxes

TITLE: A rise in attacks on schools has left Brazil reeling â and searching for solutions
SUMMARY: The numbers are far less than in the U.S. but school attacks are definitely on the increase, prompting national debate and soul-searching â and a debate over strategies to prevent future tragedies.

TITLE: Police came to pull a Jeep out of a lake. They found a woman inside, alive
SUMMARY: It wasn't until after a tow truck came that anyone realized someone was in the vehicle, some 40 feet from shore in a Texas lake.

SUMMARY: Two rulings on the abortion drug mifepristone raise questions about the FDA's authority. NPR's Michel Martin talks with medical ethics expert Holly Fernandez Lynch of the University of Pennsylvania.

SUMMARY: It's the fifth fire-related death this year in New York City where officials have said an e-bike was the cause. A father and his five children were in the second-story apartment when the fire began.

SUMMARY: Nickolas Wilt, a 26-year-old rookie officer, ran towards a gunman who opened fire at a Louisville bank on Monday. He's the latest to be heralded as a hero amid America's gun violence crisis.

TITLE: PHOTOS: See the wildflower 'superbloom' happening across California
SUMMARY: Thanks to a very wet year, the Golden State is experiencing a rare "superbloom" that's blanketing the ground with a variety of richly colored plants.

TITLE: Brittney Griner is working on a memoir about her captivity in Russia
SUMMARY: Saying she is ready to share the "unfathomable" experience of being arrested and incarcerated in Russia, basketball star Brittney Griner is working on a memoir that is scheduled for spring 2024.

TITLE: Democrats will flock to Chicago for the party's 2024 convention
SUMMARY: This will be the 13th time in the DNC's history that Chicago will host a convention. Democrats nodded toward the "Blue Wall" of Midwestern states they need to win in 2024.

SUMMARY: A medical ethics expert says a Texas abortion pill ruling is unprecedented because a federal judge "standing in" for  regulators could have far-reaching implications beyond mifepristone.

SUMMARY: The New York prosecutor who is pursuing criminal charges against former President Trump says a GOP-led congressional panel is trying to interfere with with his case. Now he's taking them to court.

TITLE: The AR-15 style rifle used in the Louisville shooting was bought legally
SUMMARY: Authorities said the 25-year-old gunman purchased the weapon from a Louisville dealer on April 4, six days before the attack.

TITLE: Gen Z is the most pro union generation alive. Will they organize to reflect that?
SUMMARY: A recent poll shows that public support for labor organizing is the highest it's been in decades. But union membership is at an all-time low. Will Gen Z bridge that gap?

TITLE: Louisville authorities release police body camera footage from the shooting
SUMMARY: Video shows officers being fired at when they arrive at the scene. Authorities said the gunman legally purchased the AR-15 style rifle used in the attack.

TITLE: Military airstrikes on a Myanmar village are feared to have killed 100
SUMMARY: Airstrikes by Myanmar's military killed as many as 100 people, including many children, who were attending a ceremony held by opponents of army rule.

TITLE: An industrial fire in Indiana sends massive clouds of black smoke into the sky
SUMMARY: The fire occurred at a former factory site in Richmond, 70 miles east of Indianapolis, that lately had been used to store plastics and other materials for recycling or resale.

TITLE: As many as 100 people were killed after military airstrikes hit a village in Myanmar
SUMMARY: Airstrikes by Myanmar's military killed as many as 100 people, including many children, who were attending a ceremony held by opponents of army rule.

TITLE: Jeremy Renner attends the premiere of new series just months after snowplow accident
SUMMARY: Renner was surrounded by family and supporters at the premiere of series showing how large vehicles are turned into community spaces for young people in India, Mexico, Chicago and Nevada.

TITLE: A California man pleads guilty to selling dozens of fake Basquiat paintings
SUMMARY: A former auctioneer has pleaded guilty to selling fake Jean Michel-Basquiat paintings, the Department of Justice said Tuesday.

TITLE: What to know about the Lori Vallow Daybell 'zombie' multiple-murder trial
SUMMARY: The trial is finally underway for Lori Vallow Daybell. Prosecutors accuse her of killing two of her children, in part due to beliefs about zombies and the end of the world.

TITLE: A Vietnam War massacre case from 1968 forces a new reckoning in South Korea
SUMMARY: A Vietnamese woman sued South Korea's government over a wartime massacre in her village by South Korean soldiers. A Seoul court recently ruled in her favor but the government will appeal the decision.

SUMMARY: Every year, the Librarian of Congress announces 25 sound recordings to be preserved for posterity. Picks for 2023 include music by Queen Latifah, Daddy Yankee, John Lennon, Mariah Carey and more.

TITLE: Biden administration says fentanyl-xylazine cocktail is a deadly national threat
SUMMARY: The White House says drug deaths linked to a mix of synthetic drugs including fentanyl and xylazine â also known as tranq â are a major public health threat. The drug cocktail is spreading fast.

TITLE: The big reason why the U.S. is seeking the toughest-ever rules for vehicle emissions
SUMMARY: The EPA is proposing tailpipe emission rules so strict that carmakers would need two-thirds of their sales to be zero-emission by 2032 to comply. And that seems to be precisely the goal.

TITLE: Judge lectures Fox attorneys over dual roles for Rupert Murdoch
SUMMARY: A judge said Fox lawyers previously "represented to him more than once" that Murdoch was not an officer for the cable network. Such information "could have" led him to make different rulings, he said.

TITLE: The surprising science of how pregnancy begins
SUMMARY: The start of pregnancy â as well as exactly when that happens â is a hot topic in some state legislatures and U.S. courts. Understanding the nuances of what happens when has never been more important.

SUMMARY: Broken glass, empty desks and a love story: War brought upheaval, scattering classmates across the world. Here's how they're settling in after schooling, friendships and families were uprooted.

TITLE: Inflation eased in March but prices are still climbing too fast to get comfortable
SUMMARY: Consumer prices in March were up 5% from a year ago. While inflation has eased from a four-decade high last summer, prices are still rising faster than the Federal Reserve would like.

TITLE: South Carolina Sen. Tim Scott takes a significant step toward a presidential run
SUMMARY: South Carolina Sen. Tim Scott has taken a significant step toward a presidential bid, launching an exploratory committee. Scott, 57, is the only Black Republican currently in the U.S. Senate.

SUMMARY: The actor and former California governor tweeted a video of him and a helper repairing a road in the Brentwood area. "You have to do it yourself. This is crazy," he said.

TITLE: Maryann spent her life advocating for people who accidentally killed others
SUMMARY: Maryann Gray founded an organization and support group for people who had unintentionally killed or seriously injured others. She died recently at the age of 68.

SUMMARY: Do you live in a place that feels increasingly divided over social issues, where disputes spill out in school board meetings, city government, or public spaces? NPR wants to  hear from you.

TITLE: Memphis council votes on whether to send Justin J. Pearson back to Tennessee House
SUMMARY: Less than a week after Republicans expelled him from the state House after leading a protest in the legislature calling for gun law reforms, Justin J. Pearson could get his seat back.

TITLE: NPR quits Twitter after being falsely labeled as 'state-affiliated media'
SUMMARY: NPR's official Twitter feeds have gone silent. The news organization cites the social media platform's decision to question NPR's editorial independence through a series of inaccurate labels.

SUMMARY: Jordan wore the Air Jordans during the second half of Game 2 of the NBA Finals in 1998, a historic season widely known as Jordan's "Last Dance."

TITLE: Maryann Gray spent her life advocating for people who accidentally killed others
SUMMARY: Maryann Gray founded an organization and support group for people who had unintentionally killed or seriously injured others. She died recently at the age of 68.

SUMMARY: An evacuation order remains in place for people within a half-mile of the industrial site in Richmond, but authorities say firefighters have contained the blaze.

TITLE: Mexico immigration agency chief will be charged in migrant center fire that killed 40
SUMMARY: Mexican federal prosecutors say Francisco GarduÃ±o was remiss in not preventing the disaster in Ciudad JuÃ¡rez last month despite earlier indications of problems at his agency's detention centers.

TITLE: A doctor reflects on the challenges of caring for a parent with Alzheimer's
SUMMARY: Dr. Sandeep Jauhar says caring for his dad was the hardest journey he's ever taken. His memoir<em>, My Father's Brain,

SUMMARY: The announcement ended speculation about whether Harry would be welcome after leveling charges of racism and media manipulation at the royal family. Meghan and their children will remain in the U.S.

TITLE: Memphis council votes to send Justin J. Pearson back to Tennessee House
SUMMARY: Less than a week after Republicans expelled him from the state House after leading a protest in the legislature calling for gun law reforms, Justin J. Pearson gets his seat back.

TITLE: The world's shortest dog is Pearl, a dollar-sized diva who loves dressing up
SUMMARY: The new world record-holder stands shorter than a Popsicle stick at 3.59 inches and follows a long line of low dogs. The chihuahua's owner describes her as "small like a ball" and "a bit of a diva."

TITLE: Tulsa Race Massacre investigators say they've sequenced DNA from 6 possible victims
SUMMARY: The work is part of a years-long effort to get an accurate count of how many people were killed when a white mob decimated the city's prosperous Greenwood enclave, leaving upward of 300 people dead.

TITLE: What's the origin of the long-ago Swahili civilization? Genes offer a revealing answer
SUMMARY: Genetic analyses back up what Swahili oral tradition has long held about ancestry of people from eastern Africa â that their ancestors are from Africa and abroad.

TITLE: Both Black Tennessee lawmakers have been reinstated after being expelled by GOP
SUMMARY: Less than a week after Republicans expelled him from the state House after leading a protest in the legislature calling for gun law reforms, Justin J. Pearson gets his seat back.

TITLE: An 'absurd' law will put the Louisville shooter's gun back on sale, mayor says
SUMMARY: A Kentucky law would force authorities to send the assault rifle used in the attack to auction, over the objections of the Louisville mayor who is pushing for change.

TITLE: The EPA says Americans could save $1 trillion on gas under its auto emissions plan
SUMMARY: The EPA says Americans could save up to $1.1 trillion in gas if the country adopts its proposal to impose the most stringent auto emission regulations ever.

TITLE: The Arizona House expels a Republican lawmaker for her role in baseless testimony

TITLE: Swimming pools and lavish gardens of the rich are driving water shortages, study says
SUMMARY: Socioeconomic disparity is just as influential as climate change and population growth when it comes to explaining why so many cities are struggling with their water supply, researchers say.

TITLE: Fort Lauderdale airport and schools closed due to 20 inches of rain in some areas
SUMMARY: The area received between 14 and 20 inches of rain Wednesday, and a few more inches are possible, according to the National Weather Service.

SUMMARY: Regulators need to decide how to recover the cost of rescuing Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank â and community banks across the country are warning they should not be on the hook.

SUMMARY: Scientists have created a new version of a historic black hole image that was first unveiled back in 2019. The central black nothingness now looks larger and darker.

SUMMARY: Shanquella Robinson, 25, of Charlotte, N.C., was killed last October while vacationing in Mexico with friends.

SUMMARY: The Biden administration had asked the higher court to stay a decision from a Texas judge while the appeal plays out.

TITLE: Feinstein asks to be temporarily replaced on Judiciary Committee amid calls to resign
SUMMARY: The move could help Senate Democrats advance more federal judges for confirmation. Feinstein, the oldest member of Congress, hasn't cast a vote since Feb. 16.

TITLE: Women are earning more money. But they're still picking up a heavier load at home.
SUMMARY: A new Pew Research Center report finds that in opposite-sex marriages in the U.S., women's financial contributions have grown, but they're still doing a larger share of housework and caregiving.
