SUMMARY: Each season will be based on one book in the beloved series by controversial author J.K. Rowling, and the cast will be different from the films. Some fans are unhappy about Rowling's involvement.

TITLE: A rare fireball flew over Maine. Now there's a $25K reward for pieces of space rock
SUMMARY: The Maine Mineral and Gem Museum is looking for meteorites from a rare fireball event near the Maine-Canada border. It's willing to pay anyone who can find them.

TITLE: Will Fox News pay for spreading lies about voter fraud?
SUMMARY: <em>New York Times

TITLE: Police make an arrest in San Francisco death of tech executive Bob Lee, official says
SUMMARY: A San Francisco supervisor says an arrest was made early Thursday in the downtown stabbing death of the Cash App founder.

TITLE: Justice Department will ask the Supreme Court to restore full access to abortion pill
SUMMARY: The Justice Department is seeking emergency relief from the U.S. Supreme Court in a Texas case involving limited access to the abortion drug mifepristone.

TITLE: Hostage envoy says the U.S. can bring home two Americans detained in Russia
SUMMARY: The U.S. special envoy for hostage affairs says he is confident that two Americans detained by Russia can be brought home.

TITLE: Biden moves to expand DACA recipients' access to government-funded health insurance
SUMMARY: The Department of Health and Human Services will propose an amended definition of "lawful presence" to include recipients of the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program, the White House said.

TITLE: Air National Guardsman identified as suspected leaker of Pentagon documents
SUMMARY: The FBI has identified a member of the Massachusetts Air National Guard, Jack Teixeira, as a suspect in the leak of classified intelligence documents, according to a person familiar with the matter.

TITLE: Women are earning more money. But they're still picking up a heavier load at home
SUMMARY: A new Pew Research Center report finds that in opposite-sex marriages in the U.S., women's financial contributions have grown, but they're still doing a larger share of housework and caregiving.

TITLE: Share your story: Have you used medication for abortion or miscarriage care?
SUMMARY: NPR would like to hear from you. With the future of some abortion pills in jeopardy, tell us about your experience using medication to end a pregnancy or treat a miscarriage.

TITLE: Air National Guardsman arrested as suspected leaker of Pentagon documents
SUMMARY: The FBI has arrested a member of the Massachusetts Air National Guard, Jack Teixeira, as a suspect in the leak of classified intelligence documents.

TITLE: This 9-year-old girl helped lead the Bulls to a screaming comeback win. Literally
SUMMARY: Diar DeRozan is the daughter of Chicago Bulls player DeMar DeRozan, and while she isn't officially on the team, she had an outsized impact on the stunning victory.

TITLE: Russia races to pass tough new military draft rules, banning conscripts from leaving
SUMMARY: The law could have big implications for the Kremlin's war plans in Ukraine, especially as it tries to recruit thousands more troops in anticipation of a Ukrainian counteroffensive.

TITLE: Supreme Court leaves student loan settlement in place
SUMMARY: The Supreme Court on Thursday refused to block a settlement in a long-running suit involving the adjudication of applications for the cancellation of student loan debts at 151 for-profit colleges.

TITLE: A tech consultant is arrested in the killing of Cash App founder Bob Lee
SUMMARY: Nima Momeni was booked on suspicion of murder in Lee's stabbing death last week in San Francisco. Police declined to give details on how they linked the death to Momeni or how the men knew each other.

TITLE: Daddy Yankee's 'Gasolina' is the National Recording Registry's first reggaeton song
SUMMARY: On Wednesday, the mega-hit single became the first reggaeton song to be inducted into the National Recording Registry at the Library of Congress.

TITLE: North Korea tests a powerful new kind of missile
SUMMARY: North Korea has successfully tested a solid-fueled ICBM, a type of missile that can be launched far more quickly than its current ones.

TITLE: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis signs bill banning abortion after 6 weeks of pregnancy
SUMMARY: The ban gives Gov. DeSantis a key political victory among Republican primary voters as he prepares to launch a presidential candidacy built on his national brand as a conservative standard bearer.

TITLE: Florida governor signs bill banning abortion after 6 weeks of pregnancy
SUMMARY: The ban gives Gov. DeSantis a key political victory among Republican primary voters as he prepares to launch a presidential candidacy built on his national brand as a conservative standard bearer.

TITLE: Minneapolis awards $8.9 million to 2 people claiming Derek Chauvin kneeled on them
SUMMARY: Chauvin has pleaded guilty to charges stemming from claims he kneeled on a teenager's neck in 2017, while he is accused of kneeling on a woman's neck earlier in that year.

TITLE: Need to charge your phone? Think twice â "juice jackers" might come for you
SUMMARY: "Juice Jacking" has become so prevalent that the FBI is now warning the public about it.

TITLE: Why New Mexico has one of the top rates for killings by police
SUMMARY: A shooting last week in Farmington, N.M., where police went to the wrong house and killed a man, is just the latest example of lethal force being used against civilians in the state.

TITLE: Here's what really happened during the abortion drug's approval 23 years ago
SUMMARY: A Texas judge ruled that the Food and Drug Administration wrongly approved mifepristone in 2000 and accused it of doing a rush job. Here's what really went down.

TITLE: The math behind Dominion Voting System's $1.6 billion lawsuit against Fox News
SUMMARY: If Dominion prevails in its massive defamation suit against Fox News, a big challenge for the voting tech company will be to demonstrate that it deserves more than $1 billion in damages.

TITLE: The pharmaceutical industry urges courts to preserve access to abortion pill
SUMMARY: As the debate over mifepristone makes its way to the Supreme Court, the pharmaceutical industry has raised concerns that ruling against the FDA could chill the development of new drugs.

TITLE: Pierce was lying on the road after being hit by a car. A stranger saved him
SUMMARY: When Pierce Forde was hit by a car while riding his motorcycle in the 1990s, a stranger stayed by his side. Forde says he wouldn't be alive without that man's help.

TITLE: You're less likely to get long COVID after a second infection than a first
SUMMARY: The chances of developing lingering symptoms after COVID appears to fall sharply from the first to the second time someone gets sick, new research finds. The risk is still significant.

TITLE: Why New Mexico has one of the highest rates for killings by police
SUMMARY: A shooting last week in Farmington, N.M., where police went to the wrong house and killed a man, is just the latest example of lethal force being used against civilians in the state.

TITLE: He was lying on the road after being hit by a car. A stranger saved him
SUMMARY: When Pierce Forde was hit by a car while riding his motorcycle in the 1990s, a stranger stayed by his side. Forde says he wouldn't be alive without that man's help.

TITLE: Need to charge your phone? Think twice â 'juice jackers' might come for you
SUMMARY: "Juice Jacking" has become so prevalent that the FBI is now warning the public about it.

TITLE: A robot answers questions about health. Its creators just won a $2.25 million prize
SUMMARY: At the Skoll World Forum this week, South Africa's Reach Digital Health was one of five honorees. They offer health advice via mobile phones to millions, focusing on pregnancy, babies and COVID.

TITLE: DOJ asks Supreme Court to intervene in case that limits access to abortion drug
SUMMARY: The Justice Department is looking to reinstate full access to mifespristone after an appeal to the Fifth Circuit resulted in access with limitations.

TITLE: Suspected leaker of secret Pentagon documents arraigned in Massachusetts
SUMMARY: A federal judge in Boston has ordered Jack Teixeira, the 21-year-old member of the Massachusetts Air National Guard, to remain in custody until his detention hearing next week.

TITLE: Separating climate change and inequality won't work, says Biden's World Bank nominee
SUMMARY: Ajay Banga, the next nominee to lead the World Bank, says it will take trillions of dollars of investment and global partnerships to meet the world's challenges.

TITLE: What could make a hoax call reporting a school shooting worse? Social media
SUMMARY: NPR has documented an alarming pattern of hoax school shooting calls across the country. Now another pattern has emerged: bad actors using these moments to spread misinformation online.

TITLE: Florida has a new abortion ban after 6 weeks, but it can't go into effect yet
SUMMARY: The ban gives Gov. DeSantis a key political victory among Republican primary voters as he prepares to launch a presidential candidacy built on his national brand as a conservative standard bearer.

TITLE: Remembering restaurant critic and food writer Mimi Sheraton
SUMMARY: Sheraton, who died April 6, was the first woman to review restaurants for The New York Times. Her opinions were reputed to have the power to make or break new restaurants. Originally broadcast in '87.

TITLE: Seeing a red flag warning in your weather app? Here's what to do
SUMMARY: Red flag warnings mean an increased risk of wildfires in the next 12 to 24 hours, so fire safety is extra important. How do they differ from fire weather watches? And what precautions should you take?

TITLE: What we know about Jack Teixeira, the suspected leaker of Pentagon documents
SUMMARY: Jack Teixeira, a 21-year-old member of the Massachusetts Air National Guard, allegedly posted classified documents on a private Discord channel where users were fascinated by guns and racist memes.

TITLE: U.S. charges El Chapo's sons and other Sinaloa cartel members in fentanyl trafficking
SUMMARY: Members of the Mexican cartel are facing several charges involving fentanyl trafficking, weapons and money laundering in New York, Illinois and Washington, D.C.

TITLE: The Taliban again bans Afghan women aid workers. Here's how the U.N. responded
SUMMARY: The Taliban has banned Afghan women working for the U.N. or other aid agencies. The repercussions could be devastating for programs in which women play a vital role.

TITLE: The book ban fight is intensifying in Llano, Texas
SUMMARY: NPR's Andrew Limbong talks with Tina Castelan, a former librarian for the Llano County Library System in Texas, about the continuing fight over certain titles on the library's shelves.

TITLE: The suspected leaker of Pentagon documents left a long trail of digital breadcrumbs
SUMMARY: The federal government is charging Jack Texiera with leaking classified documents online. He faced a judge for the first time this morning.

TITLE: Supreme Court issues a temporary stay in the Texas mifepristone case
SUMMARY: The U.S. Supreme Court has issued an administrative stay in a Texas case involving limited access to the abortion drug mifepristone.

TITLE: NYC is waging a war against rats. Meet the woman leading the charge
SUMMARY: The rats don't run this city! Allegedly.

TITLE: Ukraine hopes to rally world leaders to help fund its reconstruction
SUMMARY: Ukraine needs billions of dollars for reconstruction. Its prime minister is in Washington, D.C., this week meeting finance ministers and government officials from around the world, asking for help.

TITLE: The latest on the leaked classified documents
SUMMARY: The 21-year-old Air National Guardsman accused of leaking a trove of U.S. intelligence documents is facing charges under the espionage act. He made his initial court appearance today.

TITLE: Supreme Court briefly puts on hold lower court's limits on abortion drug mifepristone
SUMMARY: Supreme Court Justice Samuel Alito has placed a hold on a lower court ruling that restricts access to the abortion drug mifepristone until Wednesday night.

TITLE: Lori Vallow Daybell's 'zombie' murder trial has brought a string of notable moments
SUMMARY: The jury has heard testimony from Vallow Daybell's close friend, along with relatives and investigators, in the long-awaited "zombie" murder trial.

TITLE: Montana becomes 1st state to approve a full ban of TikTok
SUMMARY: Montana's bill goes farther than bans in nearly half of the states that target devices on state-issued devices. Instead, Montana's legislation makes it illegal for anyone to download TikTok.

TITLE: Arnold Schwarzenegger repaired a utility trench, not a pothole, officials say
SUMMARY: Southern California Gas Co. had covered the trench with temporary asphalt that was to be replaced with a permanent surface, the Los Angeles Department of Public Works said in a statement.

TITLE: President Macron's plan to raise the retirement age in France clears final hurdle
SUMMARY: France's Constitutional Council approved a plan to raise the retirement age to 64. Macron's office said he would enact the law soon, and he has said he wants it implemented by the end of the year.

TITLE: Japanese PM Kishida unharmed after explosion heard at port where he was due to speak
SUMMARY: Prime Minister Fumio Kishida was in the city of Wakayama, stumping for a candidate in upcoming by-elections when an explosion was heard. At least one person has been detained.

TITLE: Fear of pregnancy: One teen's story in post-Roe America
SUMMARY: In a state that bans abortion, anxiety about rape and getting pregnant drove this teen to start on birth control, though she's not having sex.

TITLE: How the Boston Marathon bombings changed Twitter, media and how we process tragedy
SUMMARY: In the aftermath of the explosions, Americans were glued to their screens, waiting for the chaos to unfurl into a narrative. Ten years later, we still process tragedies in similar ways.

TITLE: Germany begins powering down its last three nuclear plants
SUMMARY: Public pressure, stoked by disasters at Three Mile Island, Chernobyl and Fukashima, put pressure on successive German governments to end their use. Germany began winding down the plants Saturday.

TITLE: The latest saga of revealed U.S. secrets stirs memories of past legendary leaks
SUMMARY: Call them whistleblowers or traitors, call their actions conscientious or unconscionable, the people who decide on their own to share classified material have often altered the course of events.

TITLE: Scholastic wanted to license her children's book â if she cut a part about 'racism'
SUMMARY: Maggie Tokuda-Hall was thrilled when the publishing powerhouse approached her to feature her book about a love story set in an internment camp during WWII. Then she read what the deal would involve.

TITLE: Macron's unpopular plan to raise France's retirement age is enacted into law
SUMMARY: French President Emmanuel Macron's unpopular plan to raise the retirement age from 62 to 64 was enacted into law Saturday. The authorized changes will start being implemented in September.

TITLE: Journalist Evan Gershkovich tells family he's 'not losing hope' in Russian detention
SUMMARY: The family of Wall Street Journal reporter's Evan Gershkovich received a handwritten letter from him on Friday â the first direct contact with them since his arrest in the end of March.

TITLE: Gunfire and explosions erupt across Sudan's capital as military rivals clash
SUMMARY: Fighting erupted Saturday morning in Khartoum between two factions of Sudan's armed forces. A paramilitary group said it has taken control of the presidential palace, the state TV station and airport.

TITLE: Biden taps Lady Gaga to co-chair an arts advisory committee that dissolved under Trump
SUMMARY: The President's Committee on the Arts and the Humanities will advise the president on cultural policy, and members were chosen due to their "serious commitment to the arts and humanities."

TITLE: U.S. Coast Guard and Mexican navy are searching for 3 missing American sailors
SUMMARY: The U.S. Coast Guard said three sailors identified as Kerry O'Brien, Frank O'Brien and William Gross were last heard from on April 4. They were aboard a 44-foot boat due to stop in Cabo San Lucas.

TITLE: Across the country, abortion rights advocates rally in support of abortion pill access
SUMMARY: A judge in Texas issued a ruling that could severely restrict mifepristone access in the U.S., making the future of a drug used in more than half of American abortions uncertain.

TITLE: The Rutgers University faculty strike is over, for now, after a deal is reached
SUMMARY: The deal, which includes significant pay increases for graduate workers and part-time lecturers, suspends a week-long strike that had halted classes for 67,000 students.

TITLE: Sudan's army and RSF are doing battle, leaving 56 civilians dead
SUMMARY: Sudan's military and a powerful paramilitary force battled fiercely in the capital and other areas, dealing a new blow to hopes for a transition to democracy and raising fears of a wider conflict.

TITLE: 2 people have died after a shooter in Louisville opened fire in a crowded park
SUMMARY: An unidentified suspect fired a gun into a crowd of hundreds in a Kentucky park, leaving two people dead and four wounded Saturday night, police said.

TITLE: Sudan's army and RSF are doing battle, leaving dozens of civilians dead
SUMMARY: Sudan's military and a powerful paramilitary force battled fiercely in the capital and other areas, dealing a new blow to hopes for a transition to democracy and raising fears of a wider conflict.

TITLE: In New York, a nonprofit helps Ukrainian refugees make a home
SUMMARY: One of the more daunting tasks facing Ukrainian refugees who come to New York is finding a place to live. A Manhattan real estate executive has been helping to find them apartments at reduced rents.

TITLE: SpaceX prepares to launch its mammoth rocket 'Starship'
SUMMARY: Starship is the largest rocket ever built. The company hopes it will one day take people to the moon and Mars. But first it has to fly.

TITLE: A former Indian politician and his brother were shot dead live on TV
SUMMARY: A former Indian lawmaker convicted of kidnapping and facing murder and assault charges was shot dead along with his brother in a dramatic attack that was caught live on TV in northern India.

TITLE: Are you getting more voice notes these days? You're not alone
SUMMARY: Also colloquially known as a "voice text" or "voice message," the feature has been in our phones for years. But only recently has it emerged as a go-to communication method â especially for Gen Z.

TITLE: The improbable fame of a hijab-wearing teen rapper from a poor neighborhood in Mumbai
SUMMARY: First Saniya wrote poems. Then she began rapping. Now she appears on TV and YouTube and before big crowds, spreading her message about justice. Her father the rickshaw driver is her chauffeur.

TITLE: The $1.6 billion Dominion v. Fox News trial starts Monday. Catch up here
SUMMARY: Dominion Voting Systems is suing Fox News and its parent company Fox Corp. for knowingly airing false claims that its machines rigged the 2020 election against ex-President Donald Trump.

TITLE: A 15-year-old law would end fossil fuels in federal buildings, but it's on hold
SUMMARY: A 2007 law could help the country meet its climate change goals by barring fossil fuels from new and remodeled federal buildings. But the law has been on hold and gas utilities want to repeal it.

TITLE: Out-of-staters flocking to places where abortions are easier to get
SUMMARY: States with strong abortion rights protections are seeing many more abortion seekers, mostly from neighboring states with abortion restrictions.

TITLE: Biden bets big on bringing factories back to America, building on some Trump ideas
SUMMARY: President Biden has embraced the idea of subsidies for key industries and measures to shut out Chinese competitors. Reviving manufacturing is a theme he's expected to run on in 2024.

TITLE: Battles in Sudan have stretched into a second day, leaving dozens of civilians dead
SUMMARY: Sudan's military and a powerful paramilitary force battled fiercely in the capital and other areas, dealing a new blow to hopes for a transition to democracy and raising fears of a wider conflict.

TITLE: At least 4 people were killed in a shooting at teen's birthday party in Alabama
SUMMARY: Over 17 ambulances responded to a shooting in downtown Dadeville, Ala. â a small city located about an hour's drive from the state capital of Montgomery.

TITLE: At least 4 people were killed in a shooting at a teen's birthday party in Alabama
SUMMARY: The attack in the city of Dadeville came as people were gathering to celebrate a teen's 16th birthday. Authorities said there were "multiple injuries" in addition to those killed.

TITLE: Out-of-staters are flocking to places where abortions are easier to get
SUMMARY: States with strong abortion rights protections are seeing many more abortion seekers, mostly from neighboring states with abortion restrictions.

TITLE: An Oregon man threw money from his car, littering a highway with $100 bills
SUMMARY: The Oregon State Police said no criminal charges were being considered against Colin Davis McCarthy, 38, of Eugene.

TITLE: 4 were killed and 28 injured in a shooting at a teen's birthday party in Alabama
SUMMARY: The attack in the city of Dadeville came as people were gathering to celebrate a 16th birthday. Authorities have offered little information about a suspect, about the victims and about what happened.

TITLE: Residents near Indiana warehouse fire may have asbestos on their property, EPA says
SUMMARY: Officials said some of the material that burned at a former plastic recycling plant in Richmond, Ind., contained asbestos, a known carcinogen. The EPA tells people not to touch any debris they find.

TITLE: The $1.6 billion Dominion v. Fox News trial starts Tuesday. Catch up here
SUMMARY: Dominion Voting Systems is suing Fox News and its parent company Fox Corp. for knowingly airing false claims that its machines rigged the 2020 election against ex-President Donald Trump.

TITLE: Dozens of civilians are dead as rival military factions battle for control of Sudan
SUMMARY: Sudan's military and a powerful paramilitary force battled fiercely in the capital and other areas, dealing a new blow to hopes for a transition to democracy and raising fears of a wider conflict.

TITLE: Former NBA star Shawn Kemp is charged with 1st-degree assault in a March shooting
SUMMARY: Kemp said he was shot at first after he tracked down his stolen cell phone and confronted the person he presumed had it. Kemp was released from jail and not initially charged after the incident.

TITLE: Russia sentences opposition activist Vladimir Kara-Murza to 25 years in prison
SUMMARY: Kara-Murza's sentence is the harshest prison term delivered yet to a government opponent since the Kremlin launched its war in Ukraine in February 2022.

TITLE: Joshua Wong sentenced in another Hong Kong activism case
SUMMARY: Hong Kong activist Joshua Wong was sentenced Monday to 3 months in prison for breaching court bans on disclosing personal information about a police officer during 2019 anti-government protests.

TITLE: Supreme Court looks at whether Medicare and Medicaid were overbilled under fraud law
SUMMARY: Arguments on Tuesday center on a powerful tool for fighting fraud in government contracts and programs. The case examines whether major pharmacies knowingly overcharged Medicare and Medicaid.

TITLE: Teen with life-threatening depression finally found hope. Then insurance cut her off
SUMMARY: Despite laws that say mental health care should be paid for on a par with other medical care, health insurance stopped covering the care a suicidal teen needed before she was stable.

TITLE: Jamil was struggling after his daughter had a stroke. Then a doctor pulled up a chair
SUMMARY: In 2015, Dr. Mark Petersen shared difficult news about the treatment plan for Jamil Zaki's fragile newborn daughter. But instead of delivering the news and getting back to work, he pulled up a chair.

TITLE: Watch Live: Space X to launch Starship, the world's largest rocket
SUMMARY: The 400-foot-tall, stainless steel Starship could one day shuttle humans to the moon and Mars, and prove critical to launching Starlink satellites. But getting the rocket to fly is no easy feat.

TITLE: 12-year-olds can't buy cigarettes â but they can work in tobacco fields
SUMMARY: Child labor rules in agriculture are looser than those in other industries, even for tasks that are dangerous. For all tobacco laborers, but especially kids, the work can cause nicotine poisoning.

TITLE: Netflix delayed the live reunion of 'Love is Blind', but didn't say why
SUMMARY: The season four reunion of the hit reality show was supposed to premiere live at 8 p.m. ET, but it wasn't until about 9:30 p.m. that Netflix said it was having difficulties.

TITLE: Watch Live: SpaceX to launch Starship, the world's largest rocket
SUMMARY: The 400-foot-tall, stainless steel Starship could one day shuttle humans to the moon and Mars, and prove critical to launching Starlink satellites. But getting the rocket to fly is no easy feat.

TITLE: SpaceX scraps Starship launch at the last minute due to frozen valve
SUMMARY: The 400-foot-tall, stainless steel Starship could one day shuttle humans to the moon and Mars, and prove critical to launching Starlink satellites. But getting the rocket to fly is no easy feat.

TITLE: This floating ocean garbage is home to a surprising amount of life from the coasts
SUMMARY: A study of plastic trash hauled out of the Pacific Ocean found that most of it had been colonized by coastal life that was thriving right next to species that normally live in the open sea.

TITLE: Rival military factions battle for control of Sudan â dozens of civilians are killed
SUMMARY: NPR's Leila Fadel talks to former U.S. State Department special envoy for the Horn of Africa Jeffrey Feltman about the bloody struggle in Sudan between the army and rival paramilitary forces.

TITLE: Congress returns from recess with a big to-do list
SUMMARY: Addressing the fallout of a leak of classified intelligence documents and drafting legislation to avoid a default on the nation's credit limit are just a few items on Congress' to-do list.

TITLE: Why Frank Ocean's long-anticipated Coachella performance was a mixed bag
SUMMARY: Frank Ocean closed the opening weekend of the music festival Coachella. He was originally slated to headline in 2020, but the show was postponed due to COVID.

TITLE: Latest on Ukraine: Russia's prisoners, Brazil's diplomacy, the fight for Bakhmut
SUMMARY: Catch up on key developments and the latest in-depth coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

TITLE: A Spanish athlete spent 500 days alone in a cave â for science
SUMMARY: Beatriz Flamini was 48 when she entered the Granada cave in November 2021, and 50 when she emerged on Friday. Her experiment aims to shed light on the physical and mental effects of isolation.

TITLE: Why two military rivals are in a 'fight to the death' in Sudan
SUMMARY: Fierce fighting has spread outside Sudan's capital, Khartoum, and across the country, as the forces of two warring military leaders battle for control.

TITLE: Netflix delayed the live reunion of 'Love is Blind,' but didn't say why
SUMMARY: The Season 4 reunion of the hit reality show was supposed to premiere live at 8 p.m. ET, but it wasn't until about 9:30 p.m. that Netflix said it was having difficulties.

TITLE: Speaker McCarthy outlines GOP debt limit plan, Democrats pan demands as extreme
SUMMARY: Talks over raising the nation's borrowing authority are stalled so House Speaker McCarthy says GOP will vote on their own plan. Democrats say adding demands to avoid a historic default is reckless.

TITLE: Officials have identified the four people who died in an Alabama shooting
SUMMARY: Another 28 people were injured. Authorities have given few details about the weekend shooting during a birthday party, including if they knew of any suspects or a motive.

TITLE: The world's fastest marathoner wanted Boston under his belt. The day had other plans.
SUMMARY: Turns out, Mondays can suck for everyone.

TITLE: How disappearing ice in Antarctica threatens the U.S.
SUMMARY: Galveston, Texas has some of the fastest sea level rise in the world. To protect the city, engineers need to know how fast ice in West Antarctica will melt. Scientists are racing to figure it out.

TITLE: Outrage grows over the shooting of a Black teenager who rang the wrong doorbell
SUMMARY: Ralph Yarl, a 16-year-old high school junior, was shot by a homeowner after he went to the wrong address to pick up his younger brothers, his family says. The shooter has not yet been charged.

TITLE: Rapper E-40 says 'racial bias' is to blame for ejection from Warriors-Kings playoff
SUMMARY: The Sacramento Kings say the team is currently investigating the incident and the exact reason why the rapper was removed from the arena.

TITLE: After days of outrage over the shooting of a Black teen, officials charge the gunman
SUMMARY: Ralph Yarl, a 16-year-old high school junior, was shot by a white homeowner after he went to the wrong address to pick up his brothers. The shooter was charged on Monday after criticism over delays.

TITLE: Officials have identified the 4 people who died in the Alabama shooting
SUMMARY: Another 32 people were injured. Investigators said they were still working to "solidify a motive and potential suspects."

TITLE: FBI arrests 2 on charges tied to Chinese outpost in New York City
SUMMARY: In addition to the two arrests, U.S. authorities charged about three dozen officers with China's national police force with using social media to harass dissidents inside the United States.

TITLE: It's true: Rep. George Santos announces his bid for reelection
SUMMARY: Santos enters the race as an underdog â abandoned by many fellow Republicans while facing investigations over a myriad of allegations about falsehoods during his last campaign.

TITLE: Canada's public broadcaster pauses Twitter after 'government-funded media' label
SUMMARY: The Canadian Broadcasting Corporation paused its use of Twitter after the social media platform stamped CBC's account with a label the public broadcaster says is intended to undermine its credibility.

TITLE: GOP governor says he's urged Fox News to break out of its 'echo chamber'
SUMMARY: New Hampshire Gov. Chris Sununu says he speaks with Fox leadership "all the time." He questioned panels whether Fox is doing enough to "grow the team." Sununu was addressing GOP donors in Nashville.

TITLE: The world's fastest marathoner wanted Boston under his belt. The day had other plans
SUMMARY: Turns out, Mondays can suck for everyone.

TITLE: David's Bridal files for bankruptcy for the second time in 5 years
SUMMARY: CEO James Marcum said the COVID-19 pandemic has greatly impacted its finances. During that time, the company was still spending on rent on its brick and mortar stores and factories were shut down.

TITLE: Jalen Hurts signs a record 5-year, $255 million contract with the Philadelphia Eagles
SUMMARY: Hurts' contract makes him the player with the highest annual earnings in NFL history. In three seasons, he has made two playoff appearances, was a league MVP finalist and led the team to a Super Bowl.

TITLE: A T. rex skeleton named 'Trinity' may attract millions at an auction in Zurich
SUMMARY: Investors may have to dig deep into their pockets to claim a giant Tyrannosaurus rex skeleton going up for auction on Tuesday â a first in Europe â that's been dug up from three sites in the U.S.

TITLE: Why anti-abortion groups are citing the ideas of a 19th-century 'vice reformer'
SUMMARY: Anthony Comstock pushed Congress to crack down on what he saw as harmful vices, such as pornography and contraception. An 1873 law named for him has appeared in recent court battles over abortion.

TITLE: Greenland's melting ice could be changing our oceans. Just ask the whales
SUMMARY: The massive ice sheet on Greenland is shrinking as the climate gets hotter, pouring freshwater into the Atlantic Ocean. That could be setting off a chain reaction that's altering ocean ecosystems.

TITLE: Sun's out, ticks out. Lyme disease-carrying bloodsucker season is getting longer
SUMMARY: Blacklegged ticks, the arachnids that carry Lyme disease, are out and about for more of the year thanks to warming temperatures across much of the country. Here's how to stay safe.

TITLE: COVID during pregnancy may alter brain development in boys
SUMMARY: Boys born to mothers who got COVID-19 while pregnant seem to have a higher risk of subtle developmental delays, including those associated with autism spectrum disorder.

TITLE: Who bears the burden, and how much, when religious employees refuse Sabbath work?
SUMMARY: The Supreme Court hears arguments in an important case that pits religious employees against others who have to pick up the slack on Sundays.

TITLE: 13 years after bariatric surgery, a 27-year-old says it changed her life
SUMMARY: Maria Caprigno was one of the youngest people in the U.S. to get the surgery. As parents and doctors grapple with the obesity treatment for teens, Caprigno cites the long-term benefits.

TITLE: Would you like to live beyond 100? No, some Japanese say
SUMMARY: A new survey in Japan shows that most Japanese would prefer rather not to live to the age of 100 or beyond.

TITLE: Moscow court rejects WSJ reporter Evan Gershkovich's detention appeal
SUMMARY: The U.S. journalist is accused of espionage, a charge he denies

TITLE: A woman was fatally shot by a N.Y. homeowner after she went up the wrong driveway
SUMMARY: The car carrying Kaylin Gillis, 20, was turning around after her friends realized they had made mistakenly gone to the wrong address. The 65-year-old homeowner fired at them from his porch.

TITLE: A Moscow court has rejected WSJ reporter Evan Gershkovich's detention appeal
SUMMARY: The U.S. journalist is accused of espionage, a charge he, the U.S. government and <em>The Wall Street Journal

TITLE: India's supreme court considers legalizing same-sex marriage
SUMMARY: NPR's Leila Fadel talks to journalist Shalu Yadav about India's Supreme Court hearing final arguments on a group of petitions seeking to legalize same-sex marriage in the country.

TITLE: DeSantis seeks to control Disney with state oversight powers
SUMMARY: Gov. Ron DeSantis and Florida lawmakers ratcheted up pressure on Disney World by announcing a bill that would allow the state to exert unprecedented oversight on the park resort's rides and monorail.

TITLE: An Air National Guardsman was arrested after allegedly applying to be a hitman online
SUMMARY: 21-year-old Josiah Ernesto Garcia of Hermitage, Tenn., has been charged with the use of interstate facilities in the commission of murder-for-hire. He could face 10 years in prison if convicted.

TITLE: Will India legalize same-sex marriage? Its top court hears arguments this week
SUMMARY: India's Supreme Court is hearing arguments in the historic case this week, years after it decriminalized gay sex. India could become the second place in Asia to allow marriage equality, after Taiwan.

TITLE: The White House grounds are safe after a toddler breached the fence
SUMMARY: The Secret Service sprang into action after a tiny intruder crawled through the White House fence.

TITLE: McConnell says Republicans will block effort to replace Feinstein on Judiciary panel
SUMMARY: The top Senate Republican said GOP senators are opposed to Democrats' effort to temporarily replace Sen. Dianne Feinstein, D-Calif., who is recovering from shingles.

TITLE: 'I am hearing anti-aircraft fire,' says a doctor in Sudan as he depicts medical crisis

SUMMARY: The U.S. journalist is accused of espionage, a charge he and <em>The Wall Street Journal

TITLE: 'Red Memory' aims to profile people shaped by China's Cultural Revolution
SUMMARY: Tania Branigan, once China correspondent for the<em> Guardian,

TITLE: The U.S. must deal with debt ceiling and growing debt level, Rep. Johnson says
SUMMARY: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Republican Rep. Dusty Johnson of South Dakota about the looming debt limit deadline and negotiations to reach a deal before June 1.

TITLE: Biden wants airlines to pay passengers whose flights are hit by preventable delays
SUMMARY: No airline currently offers cash compensation in addition to refunds or amenities. The White House plans to change that. The plans come after a chaotic holiday travel season.

TITLE: Latest on Ukraine: Russia marks WWII Victory Day, as Ukraine war rolls on (May 8)
SUMMARY: Catch up on key developments and the latest in-depth coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

TITLE: Yellen warns of 'calamity' unless Congress raises the debt limit. What's the holdup?
SUMMARY: The treasury secretary warns that the U.S. could default on its debt by June 1, with disastrous economic consequences. GOP Rep. Dusty Johnson explains why Republicans insist on adding conditions.

TITLE: Closing arguments start for E. Jean Carroll's claims against Trump
SUMMARY: A lawyer told a jury Monday that Donald Trump should be held accountable for sexually attacking advice columnist E. Jean Carroll in 1996 because even a former president is not above the law.

TITLE: The Brownsville driver who hit a crowd of asylum-seekers is charged with manslaughter
SUMMARY: George Alvarez, 34, faces eight counts of manslaughter and 10 counts of aggravated assault with a deadly weapon. Eight people died and 10 others were injured after he drove into a bus stop.

TITLE: 'The Last Honest Man' profiles the senator who exposed the CIA's crimes and cover-ups
SUMMARY: Journalist James Risen tells the story of Sen. Frank Church, who exposed the dirty laundry of the CIA and the FBI nearly 50 years ago, and inspired congressional oversight of intelligence agencies.

TITLE: Latest on Ukraine: Russia will mark WWII Victory Day, as Ukraine war rolls on (May 8)
SUMMARY: Catch up on key developments and the latest in-depth coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

TITLE: Here are the winners of the 2023 Pulitzer Prizes
SUMMARY: The Associated Press won two awards for its Ukraine coverage, including the prestigious Public Service award. The prize for fiction went to two books: Demon Copperfield and Trust.

TITLE: The COVID public health emergency ends this week. Here's what's changing
SUMMARY: Three years ago, the emergency declaration enabled certain tools for fighting the pandemic and protecting Americans. Now that it's expiring, here's what is changing â and what's not.

TITLE: A ball went out of bounds. The shove that followed has divided NBA fans
SUMMARY: The NBA has long grappled with how to manager player interactions with fans. But what happens when the fan owns one of the teams? After Sunday night, Denver Nuggets star Nikola Jokic wants to know.

TITLE: The 2020 census may have missed a big share of noncitizens, the bureau estimates
SUMMARY: A large share of non-U.S. citizens may have been missed in the 2020 tally of the country's residents, the Census Bureau says. The tally affects the distribution of political power and federal funds.

TITLE: A jury hears final arguments in E. Jean Carroll's claims against Trump
SUMMARY: A lawyer told a jury Monday that Donald Trump should be held accountable for sexually attacking advice columnist E. Jean Carroll in 1996 because even a former president is not above the law.

TITLE: What we know about the deadly Allen, Texas mass shooting
SUMMARY: Authorities have released the victims of some of the victims killed in the mass shooting. Also, new details are emerging about the shooter's background.

TITLE: Psychologists issue health advisory for teens and social media
SUMMARY: At a time of rising rates of depression and anxiety among teens, the American Psychological Association warns parents parents their children need more protection. when they are online.

TITLE: What we know about the deadly Allen, Texas, mass shooting
SUMMARY: Authorities have released the names of some of the victims killed in the mass shooting. Also, new details are emerging about the shooter's background.

TITLE: Buffalo Bills' Damar Hamlin says he will put the millions raised into his charity
SUMMARY: The decision begins the 25-year-old's plan for the unprecedented outpouring of support that he received after his heart stopped following a tackle during a "Monday Night Football" game in January.

TITLE: In Australia, scientists begin vaccinating koalas against chlamydia
SUMMARY: The safety and effectiveness of the vaccine, designed specifically for koalas, has previously been tested by vaccinating a few hundred koalas brought to wildlife rescue centers for other afflictions.

TITLE: A 17-year-old died in the Outer Banks after a sand dune collapsed on top of him
SUMMARY: The teenager's friends and family had been looking for him. He was found buried underneath several feet of sand.

TITLE: The FDA considers first birth control pill without a prescription
SUMMARY: The Food and Drug Administration is weighing whether to allow a birth control pill to be sold over the counter for the first time. An advisory committee opens a two-day hearing Tuesday.

TITLE: President Biden hosts top congressional leaders at White House to talk debt limit
SUMMARY: It's unlikely that Tuesday afternoon's meeting will yield drastically different responses from any of the players. Still, the June 1 deadline â when the government could run short of money â looms.

TITLE: Many people living in the 'Diabetes Belt' are plagued with medical debt
SUMMARY: More than half of the counties in the nation's so-called Diabetes Belt also have high rates of medical debt among their residents, an NPR analysis found.

TITLE: Fox isn't in the apology business. That could cost it a ton of money
SUMMARY: Fox Corp. CEO Lachlan Murdoch will address investors Tuesday. He isn't likely to apologize for the events that led to a $787-million settlement over the broadcasting of election-related falsehoods.

TITLE: Florida lawmakers want to use radioactive material to pave roads
SUMMARY: Phosphogypsum, a byproduct in the fertilizer industry, contains uranium and radium â which as the EPA notes,  forms radon, "a cancer-causing, radioactive gas."

TITLE: 'Wild Dances' puts consequences of a long-ago, faraway conflict at center
SUMMARY: By ingeniously weaving improbable and conflicting forces that make up his personal history, Eurovision expert William Lee Adams affirms an idea of home that yearns to transcend space and time.

TITLE: Top Islamic Jihad commanders and family members are dead from Israeli strikes in Gaza
SUMMARY: Palestinian health officials said 13 people were killed in all, including the commanders, their wives, several of their children and others nearby.

TITLE: Swastika Mountain is renamed Mount Halo in honor of a historical tribal leader
SUMMARY: The mountain in Oregon and a nearby town, no longer in existence, were named Swastika more than 100 years ago after a local ranch that bore the same name.

TITLE: Maternity homes provide support in a post-Roe world, but not without conditions
SUMMARY: A crisis pregnancy center in Idaho opened a maternity home in the months after the Supreme Court overturned <em>Roe v. Wade.

TITLE: Imran Khan, former Pakistan prime minister, arrested in Islamabad
SUMMARY: Khan was arrested by an anti-corruption unit outside a court in the capital Islamabad where he was facing corruption charges

TITLE: Putin assails West for unleashing 'real war' against Russia, as it marks Victory Day
SUMMARY: Russia's Victory Day ceremony was scaled back this year, amid the war in Ukraine.

TITLE: Trailblazing opera star Grace Bumbry dies at age 86
SUMMARY: The celebrated singer, who led an illustrious, jet-setting  career, broke the color barrier as the first Black artist to perform at Germany's Bayreuth Festival.

TITLE: Imran Khan, Pakistan's former prime minister, is arrested in Islamabad
SUMMARY: Paramilitary forces arrested Khan at a court in Islamabad, where he was facing corruption charges. The arrest has triggered rare pushback against the military, the country's most powerful institution.

TITLE: Ex-federal judge: Congress should pass a code of conduct for the Supreme Court
SUMMARY: NPR's A Martinez talks to retired federal judge Michael Luttig about his call for Congress to pass a code of conduct for Supreme Court justices. He talks about the strict rules he followed as a judge.

TITLE: If you're 40, it's time to start mammograms, according to new guidelines
SUMMARY: The influential U.S. Preventive Task Force issue a draft of its new breast cancer screening guidelines. They're now recommending women start younger, amid a rise in breast cancer rates.

TITLE: He followed strict rules as a judge, and wants Supreme Court justices to do the same
SUMMARY: Retired federal judge Michael Luttig says he wouldn't even accept baseball tickets in his years on the bench: "I believe that federal judges should essentially live like priests or saints or monks."

TITLE: Texas Army base Fort Hood is renamed for Hispanic 4-star general Richard Cavazos
SUMMARY: The redesignation of the installation is part of the military's larger effort to rename bases and other sites associated with the Confederacy. Cavazos is the Army's first Hispanic four-star general.

TITLE: 'Paved Paradise' examines how parking has changed the American landscape
SUMMARY: Author Henry Grabar says parking codes, parking lots and garages have shaped the landscape of cities and suburbs, and limited the creation of affordable housing.

TITLE: LGBTQ+ couples in India await the Supreme Court's decision on same-sex marriage
SUMMARY: In a landmark case, a group of 18 Indian couples has petitioned the country's Supreme Court to legalize same-sex marriage. Arguments are wrapping up this week and a decision is expected this summer.

TITLE: A jury finds Trump liable for battery and defamation in E. Jean Carroll trial
SUMMARY: Jurors believed that Carroll's allegation of sexual abuse in a Manhattan department store in the mid-1990s was more likely true than not. They awarded her $5 million in total damages.

TITLE: Senate Democrats demand more details from Harlan Crow on gifts to Justice Thomas
SUMMARY: Top Senate Democrats are pushing for new disclosures from a wealthy GOP donor with ties to Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas.

TITLE: Sen. Dianne Feinstein is set to return to Washington Tuesday following an absence
SUMMARY: Feinstein, 89, will return<strong>

TITLE: An Arizona lawmaker (who is also a minister) is under investigation for a Bible prank
SUMMARY: An ethics inquiry is examining whether Democratic state Rep. Stephanie Stahl-Hamilton, a Presbyterian minister, broke Arizona House rules when she hid Bibles from the members' lounge in a protest.

TITLE: He followed strict rules as a judge and wants Supreme Court justices to do the same
SUMMARY: Retired federal Judge Michael Luttig says he wouldn't even accept baseball tickets in his years on the bench: "I believe that federal judges should essentially live like priests or saints or monks."

TITLE: When it comes to cars, there is no housing crisis (just an existential one)
SUMMARY: One man makes the case that Americans' pursuit of abundant parking is upending our cities and our lives.

TITLE: MTV News shut down as Paramount Global cuts 25% of its staff
SUMMARY: Paramount Global, the parent company of networks including Showtime, CBS and Nickelodeon is cutting some 25% of its staff. Among the units being shutdown as a result of the downsizing is MTV News.

TITLE: A dog named Buddy Holly wins best in show at Westminster, a first for his breed
SUMMARY: The petit basset griffon VendÃ©en is a rabbit-hunting hound dog from France. It has never won best in show at the prestigious competition before.

TITLE: Rep. George Santos faces federal criminal charge
SUMMARY: Rep. George Santos, a Republican from New York, has faced controversy, calls for his resignation and probes over his many falsehoods.  Now he faces a federal criminal charge.

TITLE: Tucker Carlson says he'll take his show to Twitter
SUMMARY: The fired Fox News host announced he is bringing his show to Twitter, owned by Elon Musk, "soon." His lawyers reportedly have sent threatening letters to Fox to let him out of his contract.

TITLE: Here's the latest list of the '11 Most Endangered Historic Places' in the U.S.
SUMMARY: "It's very hard to narrow the list," says the Chief Preservation Officer of the National Trust for Historic Preservation. The 2023 list includes a gas station, an artist studio and two Chinatowns.

TITLE: A deadly shooting takes place near one of Africa's oldest synagogues
SUMMARY: The motive for the attack, reportedly by a Tunisian naval guard, was under investigation. It came as the birthplace of the Arab Spring pro-democracy uprisings faces political and economic crises.

TITLE: A new worry from fighting in Sudan: the whereabouts of Khartoum's zoo animals
SUMMARY: At least 100 animals, all kept inside enclosures, will have gone more than three weeks without food or water, said the head zoologist at the zoo.

TITLE: Remembering America's first social network: the landline telephone
SUMMARY: Young tech nerds in Seattle are trying to preserve the mysterious machines â many of them almost lost forever â that made America's landline telephone system work before the age of computers.

TITLE: How AR-15-style rifles write the tragic history of America's mass shootings
SUMMARY: The weapon used to carry out the mass shooting in Allen, Texas, is one all too familiar to Americans and lawmakers who have witnessed mass shootings occur quite frequently this year.

TITLE: 5 things to know about a major new Pew poll of Asians in the U.S.
SUMMARY: The first-of-its-kind poll of about 7,000 adults sheds new light on how Asians â both immigrants as well as those born in the U.S. â see themselves and others.

TITLE: CNN's town hall with Donald Trump takes on added stakes after verdict in Carroll case
SUMMARY: CNN's transformation away from an anti-Trump lineup includes a live town hall featuring Donald Trump. That comes with its own challenges.

TITLE: 'Warrior Girl Unearthed' revisits the 'Firekeeper's Daughter' cast of characters
SUMMARY: In this gripping follow-up to Angeline Boulley's much-lauded debut, we return to Sugar Island and meet the next generation of girls in the Firekeeper family.

TITLE: Inflation stayed high last month, compounding the challenges facing the U.S. economy
SUMMARY: Consumer prices in April were 4.9% higher than a year ago, according to the Labor Department. Prices rose 0.4% between March and April.

TITLE: Pakistan turmoil deepens after Imran Khan's arrest
SUMMARY: Khan's arrest Tuesday set off skirmishes between his supporters and police in several cities that left at least six people dead, and his continued detention raises the prospect of more unrest.

TITLE: How wine and candy helped an Australian woman survive 5 days in the bushland
SUMMARY: She doesn't normally drink, but when Lillian's car got stuck in the mud after making a wrong turn on a remote road, she downed the bottle. Police say it may have helped her survive.

TITLE: N.Y. Rep. George Santos surrenders on federal fraud charges
SUMMARY: Federal prosecutors say Santos schemed to defraud campaign donors of their cash when he allegedly used the money to pay for personal expenses, including luxury clothes.

TITLE: The James Webb Space Telescope reveals a mysterious planet to be weirdly shiny
SUMMARY: Astronomers pointed the James Webb Space Telescope at a common kind of planet that's bigger than Earth but smaller than Neptune. What they saw wasn't what they expected.

TITLE: Listen to one of the largest trees in the world
SUMMARY: A sound artist set out to capture the acoustic wonder of a famed swath of quaking aspens. It's one of the largest trees on the planet, known as Pando.

TITLE: A gun attack on an old Tunisian synagogue has killed 5 people
SUMMARY: The number of people killed in a gun attack on a synagogue on the Tunisian island of Djerba during an annual Jewish pilgrimage has risen to five. The motive for the attack was under investigation.

TITLE: Why is Sudan so prone to civil war?
SUMMARY: Sudan has suffered three internal wars spanning more than 40 years of its 67 years as a nation. Two rival generals are now battling in the capital Khartoum, raising fears of another ruinous conflict.

TITLE: Advisers to the FDA back first over-the-counter birth control pill
SUMMARY: In a unanimous vote, 17-0, a panel of advisers to the Food and Drug Administration recommended that the agency approve the first over-the-counter birth control pill.

TITLE: House Republicans ramp up claims Biden family received money from foreign contacts
SUMMARY: House Oversight Chairman James Comer said Republicans have bank records that show the Biden family has benefited financially from foreign contacts. The White House and Hunter Biden slammed the claims.

TITLE: Millions of people have long COVID brain fog â and there's a shortage of answers
SUMMARY: Psychologist James Jackson says people with long COVID experience impaired brain function and mental health issues. He offers some practical advice and support in his new book, <em>Clearing the Fog.

TITLE: Florida rejects some social studies textbooks and pushes publishers to change others
SUMMARY: In one case, references to the killing of George Floyd and the Black Lives Matter movement were removed. The list of rejected materials included books on U.S. history, the Holocaust and psychology.

TITLE: Kenyans are shocked, joyful and skeptical: a slice of life post-COVID emergency
SUMMARY: Our reporter spoke to residents of Kibera, known as Africa's largest urban slum. Many had not yet heard that the World Health Organization ended the state of "emergency." Here's what they told us.

TITLE: N.Y. Rep. George Santos pleads not guilty to federal fraud charges
SUMMARY: Federal prosecutors say Santos schemed to defraud campaign donors of their cash when he allegedly used the money to pay for personal expenses, including luxury clothes.

TITLE: The pandemic-era rule that lets you get telehealth prescriptions just got extended
SUMMARY: Telehealth flourished during the pandemic thanks to relaxed rules that allowed prescribing without an in-person visit. Federal officials have decided to keep that in place for the time being.

TITLE: Former police officer admits to felony assault on Black man after George Floyd murder
SUMMARY: Former Minneapolis police officer Justin Stetson told the court he "crossed the line" on May 30, 2020, when he repeatedly kicked, hit and kneed Jaleel Stallings in the face and head.

TITLE: A plastic sheet with a pouch could be a 'game changer' for maternal mortality
SUMMARY: A new study assesses a low-cost intervention aimed at reducing deaths from bleeding during childbirth. It's remarkably simple â and, according to a new study, quite effective.

TITLE: Meet the father-son journalists from Alabama who won a Pulitzer and changed laws
SUMMARY: Their series exposed how the police force in the town of Brookside preyed on residents to boost its revenue.

TITLE: Tributes pour in for an AFP journalist killed in Ukraine
SUMMARY: Arman Soldin was with a team of AFP journalists traveling with Ukrainian soldiers near the city of Bakhmut when the group came under fire. He was 32. The rest of the team escaped uninjured.

TITLE: Disney's Q2 earnings: increased profits but a mixed picture
SUMMARY: The Walt Disney Company reported a 13% increase in quarterly earnings on Wednesday.

TITLE: Trump wants the death penalty for drug dealers. Here's why that probably won't happen
SUMMARY: The former president is pledging to wage war against Mexico's drug cartels if reelected in 2024. His plan includes pushing Congress to institute the death penalty for drug dealers and smugglers.

TITLE: Virginia hid execution files from the public. Here's what they don't want you to see
SUMMARY: In January, the Virginia Department of Corrections restricted public access to execution records. NPR is now publishing a selection of those secret files.

TITLE: This duo rehearsed between air raid alarms. Now they're repping Ukraine at Eurovision
SUMMARY: Dozens of countries will compete in the Eurovision grand final on Saturday. Electronic duo Tvorchi is representing Ukraine, which won last year. They spoke to NPR about their journey to Liverpool.

TITLE: An EPA proposal to (almost) eliminate climate pollution from power plants
SUMMARY: Coal and natural gas-fired power plants would have to dramatically reduce the climate-warming greenhouse gasses they emit under proposed federal rules.

TITLE: Trump continues lies about election and lashes out after N.Y. verdict in town hall
SUMMARY: Trump was found liable for sexual abuse and defamation. But Trump, to be expected, dismissed all that in a CNN town hall and continued his conspiracy about the 2020 election he lost.

TITLE: 'The East Indian' imagines the life of the first Indian immigrant to now-U.S. land
SUMMARY: Brinda Charry aims to recover, reclaim, and reframe the little-known, barely footnoted history of the earliest Indian immigrant on record to what is now the United States.

TITLE: Here's what to expect in the U.S. as Title 42 ends for asylum-seekers
SUMMARY: The pandemic restrictions allowed for the quick expulsion of migrants at the border. Now that it's being lifted some officials are expecting a record influx and an impending humanitarian crisis.

TITLE: What does the end of the COVID emergency mean to you? Here's what Kenyans told us
SUMMARY: Our reporter spoke to residents of Kibera, known as Africa's largest urban slum. Many had not yet heard that the World Health Organization ended the state of "emergency." They had strong reactions.

TITLE: Pakistan's Supreme Court orders release of former Prime Minister Imran Khan
SUMMARY: The court ruled that Khan's arrest on Tuesday was illegal and said he should be released. Khan's arrest has sparked violence in major Pakistani cities.

TITLE: Want your hotel room cleaned every day? Hotel housekeepers hope you say yes
SUMMARY: Daily room cleaning used to be standard in hotels. Now, the union UNITE HERE is fighting to bring that back, as hotels have cut back citing worker shortages and changing guest preferences.

TITLE: Hammerhead sharks 'hold their breath' in deeper, colder waters, research shows
SUMMARY: Sharks are ectotherms and their internal body temperatures usually reflect the waters they swim in. Holding their breath helps them function in the frigid deep.

TITLE: Extremists groups were found guilty of seditious conspiracy for Jan. 6. Now what?
SUMMARY: <em>New York Times

TITLE: Peloton is recalling nearly 2.2 million bikes due to a seat hazard
SUMMARY: There have been reports of the seat detaching during use, causing injuries. This is Peloton's second recall for its machines. Two years ago, the company recalled its Tread+ exercise machines.

TITLE: Extremist groups were found guilty of seditious conspiracy for Jan. 6. Now what?
SUMMARY: <em>New York Times

TITLE: Pandemic hits 'stop button,' but for some life is forever changed
SUMMARY: NPR talked to hundreds of people over the course of the pandemic. As the emergency declaration ends on May 11, we asked some of them for their reflections on the past three tumultuous years.

TITLE: As conservative states target trans rights, a Florida teen flees for a better life
SUMMARY: High school sophomore Josie felt Florida officials were threatening her health care and ability to be feel safe at school. So she left. Other families of trans youth are plotting their exits as well.

TITLE: Elon Musk says 'I've hired a new CEO' for Twitter
SUMMARY: Musk indicated his successor is female, but the billionaire stopped short of naming a person.

TITLE: Adidas finally has a plan for its stockpile of Yeezy shoes
SUMMARY: One of the options Adidas considered was to destroy the Ye-designed shoes, but the company ultimately decided against it, the CEO said. Instead it will sell them and donate the proceeds to charity.

TITLE: After nearly four decades, MTV News is no more
SUMMARY: Mr. President, the world is dying to know. Is it boxers or briefs?

TITLE: As debt ceiling talks progress, Biden and lawmakers are postponing their meeting
SUMMARY: White House and congressional staff will continue to meet, but President Biden and congressional leaders will hold off on their plan to gather on Friday.

TITLE: Alabama Republican blasts an effort to rid the military of white nationalists
SUMMARY: Sen. Tommy Tuberville is under pressure for holding up military nominees over abortion policy he disagrees with. When asked about whether that is hurting military readiness, he faulted Biden.

TITLE: Virginia becomes the latest GOP-governed state to quit a voter data partnership
SUMMARY: Virginia is the eighth state to leave the bipartisan ERIC compact amid fringe conservative reports and conspiracy theories attempting to connect the system to liberal activists.

TITLE: More gay and bisexual men will now be able to donate blood under finalized FDA rules
SUMMARY: While the number of people eligible to donate blood has expanded, the agency says it will continue to monitor the safety of the blood supply.

TITLE: Lainey Wilson and Chris Stapleton triumph at Academy of Country Music Awards
SUMMARY: Lainey Wilson  won album of the year for <em>Bell Bottom Country

TITLE: Norfolk Southern railcars derail in Pennsylvania, but with no hazardous chemicals
SUMMARY: No injuries were reported after nine railcars from a Norfolk Southern freight train derailed in Pennsylvania, with no hazardous chemicals on board, fire department and company officials said.

TITLE: One way to prevent gun violence? Treat it as a public health issue
SUMMARY: Dr. Deborah Prothrow-Stith has spent decades framing violence as a public health issue. She spoke to <em>Morning Edition

TITLE: As some families learn the hard way, dementia can take a toll on financial health
SUMMARY: Reckless behavior with money can be a warning sign of cognitive decline â and the condition can put people at risk of financial ruin. There are few institutional safeguards in place.

TITLE: In Tennessee, Black immigrants navigate a tricky course to a coveted driver's license
SUMMARY: Being able to drive makes life easier. It can open up job opportunities. But it also has challenges, especially if there's a language barrier. And traffic stops can be especially high stakes.

TITLE: Turkey's president has built vast power over 20 years. But he may lose on Sunday
SUMMARY: A struggling economy and slow earthquake response add up to a tough election for President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, who has dominated Turkish politics for the past 20 years.

TITLE: Republican Sen. Bill Cassidy wants to save Social Security. Will Washington let him?
SUMMARY: The Louisiana Republican has been quietly working to build consensus around a bipartisan plan to address coming solvency issues with Social Security. So far, party leaders aren't listening.

TITLE: Victor LaValle's novel 'Lone Women' is infused with dread and horror â and more
SUMMARY: This is a wonderful novel that expertly combines adventure and terror, sprinkled with<em> The Changeling

TITLE: Companies are shedding office space â and it may be killing small businesses
SUMMARY: With so many people still working from home, companies are cutting back on office space. That spells trouble for small businesses that depend on foot traffic.

TITLE: How businesses are using designated areas to help lactating mothers
SUMMARY: The recently enacted PUMP Act requires most employers to provide private lactation spaces, but does not provide monetary support to do so.

TITLE: A Pakistani court orders former Prime Minister Imran Khan to be released on bail
SUMMARY: A Pakistani court has granted former Prime Minister Imran Khan bail in multiple cases against him, allowing for his release following his dramatic arrest earlier this week.

TITLE: A new film explains how the smartphone market slipped through BlackBerry's hands
SUMMARY: This smartly entertaining new movie tells the story of how the BlackBerry became the hottest personal handheld device on the market â only to get crushed by the iPhone.

TITLE: George Santos confessed to stealing checks in Brazil in a deal to drop charges
SUMMARY: The New York Republican congressman reached a deal with Brazilian prosecutors in which he agreed to confess and pay restitution and fines to avoid prosecution.

TITLE: Jury reaches a verdict in Lori Vallow Daybell murder trial
SUMMARY: A jury has reached a verdict in the trial of Vallow Daybell, who is accused of murdering two of her children and conspiring to kill a romantic rival. The verdict is set to be read at 2:45 p.m. ET.

TITLE: Hodding Carter III, State Department spokesman during Iran hostage crisis, dies at 88
SUMMARY: Carter was a Mississippi journalist and civil rights activist who as State Department spokesman informed Americans about the Iran hostage crisis and later won awards for his televised documentaries.

TITLE: Daniel Penny is charged with second-degree manslaughter in the death of Jordan Neely
SUMMARY: The former U.S. Marine, 24, was videotaped putting Neely in a chokehold on the NYC subway on May 1. He surrendered to police ahead of his arraignment on Friday and was released on $100,000 bail.

TITLE: Coronavirus FAQ: 'Emergency' over! Do we unmask and grin? Or adjust our worries?
SUMMARY: Now that official COVID emergency declarations have ended, how should people evaluate their risk of SARS-CoV-2? That's the subject of our frequently asked questions offering.

TITLE: Jury finds Lori Vallow Daybell guilty of murdering 2 of her children
SUMMARY: A jury in Boise, Idaho, found Lori Vallow Daybell guilty of murdering two of her children and conspiring to murder a romantic rival. Vallow Daybell, 49, could face life in prison.

TITLE: Meet the school custodian who has coached the chess team to the championships
SUMMARY: <em>Queen's Gambit

TITLE: Turkey's opposition leader poses a challenge to President Erdogan
SUMMARY: Journalist Ruth Michaelson talks about Turkish opposition leader Kemal KiliÃ§daroglu ahead of Turkey's general election.

TITLE: Biden pledged to stop funding fossil fuels overseas. It's not stopping one agency
SUMMARY: Leaders of the Export-Import Bank of the United States voted Thursday to help fund the expansion of an oil refinery in Indonesia.

TITLE: FDA changes rules for donating blood. Some say they're still discriminatory
SUMMARY: Pathologist Dr. Benjamin Mazer talks about the changing FDA rules on donating blood for men who have sex with men.

TITLE: Daniel Penny arraigned in chokehold death of Jordan Neely
SUMMARY: Daniel Penny, the 24-year-old man who put Jordan Neely in a fatal chokehold on the New York City subway last week, faces manslaughter charges.

TITLE: Teachers in Arizona tap the power of plants to teach kids resilience
SUMMARY: Kids at a Flagstaff, Arizona, elementary school have been through a lot since 2019: the pandemic, and then wildfires and a big flood. Teachers are using horticulture therapy to teach them resilience.

TITLE: A former U.S. Army general predicts 'successful' Ukrainian offensive
SUMMARY: Ex-U.S. Army Europe commanding Gen. Ben Hodges predicts success for Ukraine's long-awaited counterattack against Russia

TITLE: Fear and confusion, but not chaos, along the southern border after Title 42 ends
SUMMARY: The pandemic-era policy nearly halted the processing of asylum applications. As Title 42 was lifted on Thursday, officials braced for an influx of migrants. But the reality was relatively calm.

TITLE: Migrants are frustrated with the asylum claim app, even after the latest overhaul
SUMMARY: Immigration authorities touted a major update meant to improve CBP One, an app that's now the main authorized portal to seek asylum at the border. But migrants in JuÃ¡rez say it's still not working.

TITLE: Migrants are frustrated with the border app, even after its latest overhaul
SUMMARY: Immigration authorities touted a major update meant to improve CBP One, an app that's now the main authorized portal to seek asylum at the border. But migrants in JuÃ¡rez say it's still not working.

TITLE: A Tennessee company is refusing a U.S. request to recall 67 million air bag inflators
SUMMARY: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration is demanding that ARC Automotive Inc. of Knoxville recall 67 million inflators in the U.S. because they could explode and hurl shrapnel.

TITLE: G7 finance leaders pledge to contain inflation and to continue support for Ukraine
SUMMARY: Finance ministers and central bank chiefs ended talks in Japan with a joint statement pledging to bring inflation under control while aiding those suffering the most from surging prices.

TITLE: Tens of thousands march against Serbia's populist leadership following mass shootings
SUMMARY: Many chanted slogans decrying Serbia's president, whom they blame for creating an atmosphere of hopelessness and division they say indirectly led to the two mass shootings that killed 17.

TITLE: Group agrees to buy Washington Commanders from Snyder family for record $6 billion
SUMMARY: The deal for $6.05 billion is the largest for a North American professional sports franchise. The deal is still pending approval of three-quarters of NFL owners and other customary closing conditions.

TITLE: President Zelenskyy arrives in Rome for meetings with the pope and Italian leaders
SUMMARY: Ukrainian President Volodymr Zelenskyy arrived in Rome for talks with Italian officials and the pope, who has said the Vatican has launched a behind-the-scenes initiative to try to end the war.

TITLE: When Getty began losing her vision as a girl, she was told her life was over. Wrong!
SUMMARY: Gertrude Oforiwa Fefoame says she could not imagine "what the future had in store." She faced sorrow â but ultimately triumphed. She is the new chair of the U.N. committee for disability rights.

TITLE: This telehealth program is a lifeline for New Mexico's pregnant moms. Will it end?
SUMMARY: A federal program in remote New Mexico has helped hundreds of pregnant mothers stay healthy, but it's running out of time and money despite a growing national maternity care crisis.

TITLE: How Recep Tayyip Erdogan became Turkey's most powerful leader

SUMMARY: Some seniors got dozens of COVID tests they never ordered. Bad actors may have used seniors' Medicare information to improperly bill the federal government â and could do it again, investigators say.

TITLE: An 'extremely rare' rainbow sea slug was spotted along the coast of England
SUMMARY: The rare rainbow sea slug, or <em>Babakina anadoni

TITLE: Soaring pasta prices caused a crisis in Italy. What can the U.S. learn from it?
SUMMARY: Italian officials convened crisis talks last week to address the price of pasta, which was up a whopping 17.5% year-over-year in March. But it's far from the only country seeing a rise in food prices.

SUMMARY: Spell books, dragons, mermaids, fairies and a magic circus all take on new life in the pages of these five enchanting tales hitting shelves in May and June.

SUMMARY: The young girl died in U.S. Border Patrol custody after experiencing a "medical emergency," the agency said. The news underscores concern about the safety of migrants with Title 42 no longer in place.

SUMMARY: NPR's Leila Fadel talks to Australian Ambassador to the U.S. Kevin Rudd about President Biden deciding not to meet with leaders of Australia, India and Japan because of U.S. debt ceiling negotiations.

SUMMARY: The security forces' action came after authorities demanded that Khan hand over dozens of protesters believed to have been among those who smashed and set fire to army installations last week.

TITLE: Syria's embrace, Sudan's conflict and Saudi Arabia's rise define Arab League summit
SUMMARY: With Syria's president returning to the fold â despite U.S. resistance â and with Saudi Arabia's recent detente with Iran, this year's Arab League summit reflects a changing region.

TITLE: Disney cancels plans for $1 billion Florida campus
SUMMARY: Disney says it's not moving ahead with a planned office park in Orlando because of "new leadership and changing business conditions." Its dispute with Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis is one of the factors.

TITLE: Ukraine arrests its top judge amid an ongoing crackdown on corruption
SUMMARY: Ukraine's top judge has been arrested after allegedly receiving nearly $3 million in bribes for favorable rulings, the latest crackdown on endemic graft as Ukraine seeks to join the European Union.

TITLE: U.S. Supreme Court hands social media companies a major victory
SUMMARY: The court unanimously sided with Twitter in a case brought by plaintiffs who said it aided and abetted terrorism. Based on its opinion, it sent a related case involving Google back to lower courts.

SUMMARY: As the immigration policy known as Title 42 draws to a close, residents of Brownsville, Texas, right along the border, are focused elsewhere.

SUMMARY: Conservationists are rushing to vaccinate critically endangered California condors against deadly avian flu. Ashleigh Blackford of the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service is overseeing the effort.

SUMMARY: Officials in Escambia County, Fla., removed 10 books from school libraries and restricted access to more than 150 others. Writers' advocacy group PEN America calls the lawsuit the first of its kind.

SUMMARY: Last December, Montana banned the app on government devices. Now, it is banning the hugely popular platform outright. Where does that leave the content creators?

TITLE: FDA advisers support approval of RSV vaccine to protect infants
SUMMARY: At least 58,000 childern younger than 5 years old are hospitalized each year with RSV infections. A Pfizer vaccine given to pregnant people could help protect their infants from severe RSV illness.

SUMMARY: Schumer has takes next steps with a group of bipartisan Senate lawmakers to craft a comprehensive artificial intelligence law. "Congress must move quickly," he said Thursday.

SUMMARY: A cluster of mpox cases in the Chicago area has sparked fears of a summer wave. Health officials are pointing to new research showing the vaccine is effective and hoping people take notice.

SUMMARY: In its 7-2 ruling Thursday, the Supreme Court said the late artist infringed on a photographer's copyright when he created a series of works based on an image of the pop star Prince.

SUMMARY: Rushdie, whose attendance had not been announced beforehand, spoke briefly, and dedicated some of his remarks to those who came to his help last August while on stage at a New York literary festival.

SUMMARY: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is expected to attend the group of seven leading industrial nations' meeting in Hiroshima, Japan, this weekend,  as member states intensify sanctions on Russia.

SUMMARY: The NIH will track the diets and lifestyles of 10,000 people to see how genetics, biology and the microbiome impact people's health. The study will use AI to tailor individual diet advice.

TITLE: Rafael Nadal has pulled out of this year's French Open
SUMMARY: Nadal, who has won 14 French Opens, injured his hip in January during the Australian Open. He has pulled out of other matches earlier in the year, but has not said if he will retire.

SUMMARY: Progressive Democratic lawmakers raised the alarm over comments Biden made earlier this week suggesting he's entertaining possible changes to federal safety net programs.

SUMMARY: Veterans funding could be affected by the two high-stakes showdowns in Washington right now: budget talks and the possible default on America's debt.

SUMMARY: Since the inception of the transfer portal in 2018, the number of student athletes seeking to move colleges in the hope of finding a better path to the pros has exploded. But not everyone makes it.

SUMMARY: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is expected to meet with the group of seven leading industrial nations' meeting in Japan this weekend, as member states intensify sanctions on Russia.

SUMMARY: The hotel starts at about $4,800 for two people for two nights. Package includes lodging, meals and passes to Hollywood Studios, one of Disney World's four parks.

TITLE: Democrats, worried about a Biden-McCarthy deal, push a backup plan to avoid default
SUMMARY: Progressive Democratic lawmakers raised the alarm over comments Biden made earlier this week suggesting he's entertaining possible changes to federal safety net programs.

SUMMARY: Leah Bartell was walking home from a friend's house early one morning when she was approached. She has a message for the strangers who stepped in to help.

SUMMARY: At least four inmates died and 46 others attempted suicide from July 2021 through June 2022, according to a new report. It is the most yearly deaths and attempted suicides recorded since 2016.

SUMMARY: The nursing home resident was found alone in her room with a steak knife when the officer in question fired his Taser. The woman is now in critical condition at the hospital.

SUMMARY: Negotiators between the White House and House Speaker Kevin McCarthy's team paused talks on Friday. There's a little more than a week before the country runs out of money to pay its bills.

SUMMARY: Tim Scott has a major announcement Monday in his home state of South Carolina. He is expected to announce a run for the White House and an official FEC filing Friday makes that even more likely.

TITLE: A D.C. police lieutenant is accused of tipping off a leader of the Proud Boys
SUMMARY: Shane Lamond allegedly used his position in the Metropolitan Police Department's Intelligence Branch to share information with Enrique Tarrio, a leader with the far-right extremist group

SUMMARY: CNN's town hall last week with former President Donald Trump has crystalized dissent inside the network over the new boss' efforts to shear it of anti-Trump sentiment.

TITLE: G-7 leaders gathered in Hiroshima meet an atomic bomb survivor
SUMMARY: Japan is using the venue for the G-7 summit in Hiroshima, the first city to suffer a nuclear attack, to call for the abolition of nuclear weapons â even as it depends on U.S. nukes for protection.

SUMMARY: Georgetown Law Professor Caroline Fredrickson talks about the implications of Dianne Feinstein's health problems for the work of the Senate and the democratic agenda.

SUMMARY: If you're on the market for a "2015 Furcedes" named Buddy you're in luck, thanks to a social media manager's campaign modeled after Carvana. Pippi's Place in Atlanta has a Furrari and a Meowzda, too.

SUMMARY: In a YouTube video, the science communicator and author announced that he's recently been diagnosed with Hodgkin's lymphoma.

TITLE: An abortion doula pivots after North Carolina's new restrictions

SUMMARY: Unless Congress and the White House reach a deal to raise the debt ceiling, real people could suffer, from service members to Social Security recipients to would-be homebuyers.

SUMMARY: Negotiators between the White House and House Speaker Kevin McCarthy's team paused talks on Friday. There's a little more than a week before the country runs out of money to pay its bills.
